description: In a dingy room four floors above Broadway, seven orphan girls 7 to 11 years old struggle under stern adult eyes to memorize a thick red book. Each day for the last week they have leafed through it and read several pages aloud, only to be commanded to start all over again.

title: Major Coal Producer and Union Reach a Tentative Agreement
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20The United Mine Workers and a major coal company that is outside the industry's bargaining association signed a tentative contract agreement today that may set a pattern for other settlements and hasten an end to the 77day miners strike.

title: Cellophane: Demand Lag Continues
description: Fifty years ago, cellophane was a wonder material The new transparent wrapping revolutionized packaging and fed the growth of selfservice marketing. In 1934 Ethel Merman sang a Cole Porter song about the desirables of the day.

title: Queens College Women Keep Basketball Crown
description: NEW ROCHELLE, Feb. 20Queens College routed Cortland State, 8457, tonight and retained the New York State women's college basketball tournament title.

title: HOW TO AID THE FUND
description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and sent to P.O. Box 5193, Church Street Station, New York, N.Y. 10249 or to these agencies:

title: Foyt Goes Home; Injuries Minor
description: DAYTONA BEACH; Fla., Feb. 20 (UPI)A. J. Foyt was released from Halifax Hospital today after spending a night under, observation for minor injuries received when his car rolled over several times during the 70th lap of the Daytona 500 yesterday.

title: Joan La Barbara Sings a Collage
description: Joan La Barbara called her most recent recording Voice Is the Original Instrument, and in her compositions from that record, as in many of the pieces she has helped other composers realize, her .voice has also been the dominant instrument. Any list of performers who are expanding the potentials of .the human voice would very inelude her name at or ve near the top.

title: CYPRUS WASN'T TOLD OF COMMANDOS' AIM
description: CAIRO, Feb. 20Egyptian officials conceded today that their Government did not specifically tell Cyprus yesterday that commandos were on their way by Egyptian military plane for a rescue raid at an airport in Cyprus where two Arab gunmen held 15 hostages aboard a commandeered jetliner.

title: Leader of Hearings on Aid to City
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20Few of his classmates at Yale University in the early 1940's would have guessed that William Singer Moorhead, the funloving scion of a wealthy Pittsburgh family, would one day be a. Democratic liberal in Congress.

title: Events Today
description: BLACK AT YALE, a film by Warrington, Huc??lin; I COULD HEAR YOU ALL THE WAY DOWN THE HALL, by Robert Gardner, at the Whitney Mus??um of Art.

title: Paavo Berglund Makes His U.S Debut as Conductor
description: Paavo Berglund was born in 1929 and has had a noteworthy career in Europe  he is currently conductor of both the Helsinki Philharmonic Orchestrain his native city and of the Bournemouth Symphony Orchestra in England. But it took him until Sunday afternoon to make his American debut, which he did with the American Symphony Orchestra in Carnegie Hall.

title: Books of The Times
description: ACcording to Diane Arbus: 'Most people go through life dreading they'll have a traumatic experience. Freaks were born, with their traumas. They've already passed their test in life. They're aristocrats. According to Leslie Fiedler, these aristocrats obsess us because of their mythological resonance. Thus, at the circus sideshow, the giant, the doghead, the umbrellafoot, the oneeye, the midget, the bisexual, the cavedweller,'the longear, the mouthless one and the creature with his head between his shoulders are atavisms of the Gigantes, Cynocephali, Skiapodes, Cyclopes, Pygmies, Androgynes, Troglodytes, Phanesians, Astomi and Blemmyae out of our mythic (and animal) past.

title: Yankees Open Spring Camp With Holtzrnan Feud Revived
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Feb. 20The Yankees officially opened spring training today with Manager Billy Martip arriving half an hour late, Andy Messersmith two years late and Thurman Munson and Sparky Lyle not arriving at all.

title: Celtics (Not Washington) Go to Houston
description: The Boston Celtics and Kermit Washington separated Sunday at the Denver airport. The Celtics traveled to Houston for tonight's National Basketball Association game against the Rockets and Washington returned to Boston.

title: JOSEPH PRISANT, 62, BUILT LARGE SUBURBAN PROJECTS
description: Joseph A. Prisant, a builder of large suburban residential developments, died yesterday of cancer at his home in Kings Point, L.I. He was 62 years old.

title: C.I.A. Is Blamed for Career Problems of Exsource
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 20  For two years after he fled to the United States in 1957, Nicholas M. NagyTalavera says, he was a source for information that the Central Intelligence Agency relied on repeatedly.

title: Panel Says Judges Under Inquiry Should Not Be Allowed to Resign
description: Reporting that 30 New York State judges had recently escaped possible removal from the bench by resigning, the State Commission on Judicial Conduct recommended yesterday that judges not be allowed to resign while under investigation for disciplinary infractions.

title: CORRECTION
description: Because of a typographical error, it incorrectly stated in The New York Times on Saturday that Robert J. Smith had been named acting head of Downe Communications Inc. Mr. Smith is acting head of the broaddasting group, at Downe, replacing George Wilson, who resigned.

title: White House Denies That Jordan Accosted Woman in a Capital Bar
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20The White House, in anunusually assiduous effort to refute published reports that Hamilton Jordan, one of President Carter's top aides, spat a drink down the back of a young woman's dress at a singles bar here three weeks ago, has made public a 24page transcript of an interview with a bartender that contradicts the assertions of the 26yearold woman.

title: A New Way To Grow Truffles
description: PARISIn the midst of uncertainty about the outcome of an imminent election, terrible winter weather and a falling franc, the French have received at least one cheering piece of news: It is possihle for man to grow truffles.

title: Carter Is Criticized by Javits For Turning the Tables on Israel
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20 (AP)Senator Jacob F. Davits, Republican of New York, sharply criticized President Carter today for a sudden turning of the tables on Israel. He said Mr. Carter was pressing Israel to make concessions that disrecarded its essential security needs.

title: A Quarter Century At the Head Of the Class
description: BALTIMOREPerhaps no one in America publicly exhibits such unalloyed pep, good humor and energy in the early hours of the morning as Sally Gelbard, known to those of her friends who are between the ages of 4 and 6 as Miss Sally. Unless of course, you count Miss Marti in Witchita, Miss Soco in Los Angeles or Miss Marianne in New York, who have all taken tutelage in good temper from Miss Sally herself.

title: All Actors in New Play Try All Parts
description: In The Bandit Princess, Linda Mussman's Time and Space Theater is trying to do something that can't quite be done. But the attempt is interesting and sometimes captivating.

title: Taxes & Accounting
description: They had been lining up in Harlem since 4 in the afternoon, patiently standing on the snowcovered sidewalk holding their place numbers. Inside, the waiting room was overflowing with families bundled against the winter coldmothers rocking their infants, teenagers tapping their feet, workmen nursing one cigarette after another, awaiting turn. By the time the doors officially opened a few hours later, so many people had shown up that scores had to be turned away.

title: Smith Irks Blacks With Proposal He Head Interim Rhodesia Regime
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia. Feb. 20Prime Minister Ian D. Smith proposed today that he remain as head of the transitional government that will pave the way for black role, and that posts in the administration be divided equally between whites and blacks.

title: Holiday Closings
description: Banks, stock exchanges and commodities markets in the New York, New Jersey and Connecticut area were closed Yesterday in observance of the Washington's Birthday holiday. They will be open today.

title: Zoncert: National's Verdi Requiem
description: The Verdi Requiem has become all but a test piece for a conductor these days, and in recent years many have come to New York determined to show that their Requiem can match that of anybody in the business. Last night in Carnegie Hall it was the turn or Mstislav Rostropovich. He brought the National Symphony to town, with the University of Maryland Chorus and a oval quartet consisting of Galina Vishnevskaya, Julia Hamari, Seth McCoy and Paul Plishka.

title: Pop: Gillettes
description: Pipp and Guy Gillette, who were at the Fugue on Sunday night and will appear at Kenny's Castaways tonight through Sunday, have a tight little jump band. Pipp Gillette plays guitar and harmonica and sings most of the leads in a frazzled, bluesy voice while his brother Guy handles electric bass, more vocals and occasional second guitar. By themselves they might be a relatively ordinary folk duo, but in Charles Otis they have a marvelous New Orleans drummer with an irresistible secondline beat. Joey Stann rounds out the group playing idiomatic if somewhat derivative saxophones and flute.

title: In Yablonski, The Reporter Is Key to Play
description: HUNTINGTON. L.I.As a reporter, Richard Nelson covered the trial of W.A. Boyle, later convicted of ordering the triple murder in 1969 of Jock Yablonski, a rival United Mine Workers leader, his wife and daughter. It might be expected, that Mr. Nelson, in his role as playwright, would write a stepbystep In Cold Blood account of the case, or an On the Waterfront study of corruption in labor unions.

title: Major Coal Producer and Union Reach a Tentative Agreement
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20The United Mine Workers and a major coal company that is outside the industry's bargaining association signed a tentative contract agreement today that may set a pattern for other settlements and hasten an end to the 77day miners strike.

title: Bank Watchers Find Safety Ratings Good Business
description: For bankers,. long accustomed to scrutinizing the financial affairs of others, the shoe is on the other foot. The banks are now being scrutinized just as routinely by their own business customers.

title: A West German Paper Publishes Suicide Note Said to Be Goering's
description: BONN, Feb. 20 (AP)A West German newspaper has published a suicide note attributed to Hermann Goering in which the Nazi marshal told his wife, Emmy, he would have accepted an Allied firing squad but was killing himself to escape the indignity of being hanged.

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, FEBRUARY 21, 1978

title: Lie to Grand Jurors Major Issue in Trial In Lewisboro Killings
description: WHITE PLAINS, Feb. 20The testimony of a woman who admitted having lied before a grand jury played a major role today in the summations in the fourweek trial of two men accused of murdering two Lewisboro women last year.

title: From Entebbeto Larnaca
description: Students of unconventional warfare the world over will spend days trying to explain all that went wrong with the Egyptian commando descent on Cyprus's Larnaca Airport Sunday evening. No matter who was responsible for the tragic quarrel between Egyptian and Cypriot authorities. however, the imniediate objectives of the Egyptians were realized though at a terrible price to themselves. The 15 hostages held in a Cyprus Airways jet were released and their captorstwo Palestinians who had murdered Yousef elSebai, the editor of Egypt's leading newspaper, Al Ahramwere taken into custody.

title: Against Financing Apartheid
description: WASHINGTONSouth Africa is the only country in the world in which men and women are systematically denied fundamental freedoms in virtually every sphere of human endeavor on the sole basis of the color of their skin. In spite of our abhorrence or these conditions, American capital and credit have played a pivotal role in assisting the South African Government to entrench its policies of racial segregation, or apartheid, the cornerstone of the ruling National Party's philosophy for 30 years.

title: Pitt 97, Villanova 81
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 20 (AP)Pete Strickland, a reserve guard, scored all 17 of his points in the second half and led the University of Pittsburgh to a 9781 victory over Villanova tonight.

title: Researchers Seek New Male Contraceptive
description: Scientists have tried for decades to develop a modern contraceptive for men. One drug was found to stop sperm production, but it also turned men's eyes red and caused them to vomit when they drank alcohol. The female hormone progestin was shown to halt the production of sperm, but it suppresses libido, necessitating a daily injection of male hormone to restore the sex drive.

title: Secular Bookings Off, Anita Bryant Sings at Revivals
description: SAN ANTONTO, Feb. 19Anita Bryant's victory has been costly.

title: MEXICO REORGANIZES ITS STEEL INDUSTRY
description: MEXICO CITYA longawaited reorganization of the Mexican steel industry has taken place with the fusing of three state steel companies into a singlehuge enterprise that will eventually be known as Sidermex.

title: Relaxation Sought in State Limits On Budgets of Cities and Schools
description: TRENTON, Feb. 20A strong effort to amend the yearold state laws limiting spending by local governments is under way because of the rising cost of insurance and energy.

title: HOW TO AID THE FUND
description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and sent to P.O. Box 5193, Church Street Station, New York, N.Y. 10249 or to these agencies:

title: Smith Irks Blacks With Proposal He Head Interim Rhodesia Regime
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Feb. 20Prime Minister Ian D. Smith proposed today that he remain as head of the transitional government that will pave the way for black rule, and that posts in the administration be divided equally between whites and blacks.

title: Post 102. Wagner 87
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., Feb. 20Bob de Bonis scored 28 paints, George Johnson 24 and Gil Green 20 tonight and C.W. Post defeated Wagner. The Pioneers evened their season record at 1010. Wagner is 715.

title: Passaic Teachers File Criminal Suit Over Pay
description: PASSAIC, Feb. 20The teachers union in this city has taken the unusual step of filing criminal charges against the nine members of the Board of Education for what it described as unauthorized withholding of salaries.

title: Rubdown At the White House
description: When I arrived at the White House Massage Room that morning H. R. Haldeman and John Ehrlicliman were already stripped down to their towels and quarreling about who would get the first massage.. I examined them both. Ehrlichman had a small crick in his neck and Haldeman had a burr in his gluteus maximus. This was the work of the charming and witty Henry Kissinger, wh6 often sneaked up behind Haldeman while he was briefing the President and dropped burrs down Haldeihan's pahts.

title: Currency Director Forms Fraud Unit
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20  The Comptroller of the Currency has organized a new fraud squad designed to detect and investigate suspected cases of bank fraud throughout the country, it was disclosed today.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: HONOLULU, Feb. 20 (AP)Muhammad Ali will be given a rematch with the new world heavyweight champion, Leon Spinks, if Ali wants it, Bob Arum said here today.

title: Article 4 -- No Title
Plant of Oklahoma Daily Burns
description: OKMULGEE, Okla., Feb. 20 (AP)An earlymorning fire destroyed the twostory Okmulgee Daily Times building today. No injuries were reported. Assistant Fire Chief Ted Kaltenbach said investigators were looking into the possibility of arson. The Times, a member of the Donrey Media Group, publishes daily except Monday and has a circulation of 4,934.

title: DR. ROCKWOOD KEITH
description: Dr. Rockwood Keith, a surgeon in Westchester County for 30 years, died yesterday at his home in Marion, Mass. He was 71 years old.

title: Lie to Grand Jurors Major Issue in Trial In Lewisboro Killings
description: WHITE PLAINS, Feb. 20The testimony of a woman who admitted having lied before a grand jury played a major role today in the summations in the fourweek trial of two men accused of murdering two Lewisboro women last year.

title: Bank Balances and Unbalanced Language
description: Mayor Koch, over the weekend, accused New York City's commercial banks of blackmail, changed his mind yesterday, and now doesn't seem quite sure what policy the city should follow in deciding where to deposit the city's cash. The confusion is understandable; the charge of blackmail regrettable. But the Mayor raises important questions: Should social purpose influence hardheaded business decisions? If so, to what extent?

title: Official Urges Program to Train Hearing Dogs to Aid the Deaf
description: Representative Frederick W. Richmond Democrat of Brooklyn, urged the adoption yesterday of a Federal program to train hearing dogs for the deaf and hardofhearing, patterned after SeeingEye dogs for the blind.

title: Pratello Ed Scores by 6 Lengths and Pays $9
description: Just before the start of yesterday's fourth running of the Sporting Plate Handicap at Aqueduct, several horsemen outside the racing secvetaly's of fice were speculating about Fratello Ed's chances in the $43,675 sixfurlong feature.

title: Buser Named to Head Pacific Far East Lines
description: Pacific Far East Lines, the San Francisco shipping company that filed a petition earlier this month in bankruptcy court to reorganize, named yesterday Laurence J. Buser president, chief executive and a director.

title: Virginia 62, W. and M. 49
description: WILLIAMSBURG, Va., Feb. 20 (AP)Virginia's 17thranked Cavaliers,led by Jeff. Lamp and Lee Raker, opened the second half tonight with a 173 run and went on to a 62.49 victory over William and Mary.The Cavaliers, raising their record to 186 and dropping the the Indians to 159, and went from a 2523 halftime deficit to a 4028 lead. Lamp and Raker finished with 18 points each.

title: Thais Upset by Abduction of 350 Border Villagers Into Cambodia
description: UBON RATCHATHANI, Thailand, Feb. 16More than 300 Thai men, women and children were abducted from their village in Ubon Province on the Cambodian border Feb. 9 and have disappeared into Cambodia. In nearby Buriram Province, about 50 villagers were kidnapped the other night.

title: Stylish Designs Amid the Clutter
description: Annie WalwynJones turns out neatly designed clothes in the most cluttered surroundings. The ironing board in her oneroom apartment becomes a dining table when one is called for, the cutting board turns out to be the parquet floor, and the metal bookshelves hold bolts and scraps of fabric instead of books. Her books are piled on the lone upholstered chair.

title: Earle Carver Pitman Dies at 84; Chemist Helped to. Develop Nylon
description: Earle Carver Pitman, a chemical engineer who was granted several patents and who helped develop nylon and smokeless power, died Saturday at his home in Camden, Me. He was 84 years old.

title: Parents Plan Fight to Bar Closing Of Rundown School in Jersey City
description: JERSEY CITY, Feb. 20Parents of children attending Public School 5 in the downtown section of the city said today that they would fight to keep the school operating despite a leaking roof, uncaulked window frames and increasing pressure to have the school demolished.

title: Bryn Mawr to Cut 25 Faculty Posts
description: BRYN MAWR, Pa., Feb. 20  Bryn Mawr College is implementing a fiveyear budgetcutting plan. that will result in the less of 25 faculty positions, an increase in the studentfaculty ratio from 8.1 to 10.1 and the elimination of one graduate department and two undergraduate departments. according to a statement released today by the college's board of trustees.

title: City U. League Tourney To Start at City College
description: There are several things not to look for when the 13th City University of New York basketball tournament starts tonight at City College's Nat Holman gymnasium.

title: Levitt Finds Overbilling by a School for Handicapped
description: State Comptroller Arthur Levitt has accused the Maimonides School for handicapped children of inflating its claims to the state by more than $500,000 and with setting excessive tuition rates.

title: Brezhnev Receives High Victory Medal
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 20 (Reuters)Leonid I. Brezhnev was presented today with the Order of Victory, a high military award, for his contributions in World War II.

title: Free Trade Then, Now
description: The past is a foreign country, the saying goes, they do things differently there.', And so they do. Consider that classic, liberal, economic article of faith: free trade.

title: Soviet Crew Marks 72d Day Aloft
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 20 (UPI)Two Soviet astronauts maintained a busy work program today as they marked their 72d day in space, just 12 days short of the American manned space flight record. Toss, the Soviet press agency, said Yuri Romanenko and Georgy Grechko spent most of the day aboard the Salyut 6 space lab engaged in visual observation and photography of separate parts of the earth's surface and the world oceans. The astronauts were launched into space Dec. 10.

title: What the Yankees Lack: Joy
description: When the New York Yankees opened formal spring training yesterday, they should have flown their pennant at halfstaff in salute to Edna Lawson Stengel, who died the other day at the age of 83 in Glendale, Calif.

title: World News Briefs
description: LONDON, Feb. 21 (AP)The British Government rejected today a Protestant demand that capital punishment be restored in Northern'Ireland to combat terrorism.

title: Westchester Legislator Planning To Reactivate Consumer Squad
description: WHITE PLAINS, Feb. 20 (UPI) A Westchester County legislator, Carolyn I. Whittle, said today she was reactivating her consumerwatchdog super squad to help make sure consumer protection laws were being enforced.

title: HIGHER RATES SEEN, THOUGH NOT BY ALL
description: Interest rates are headed higher throughout 1978, according to the consensus among money market economists and investment analysts. The gaping Federal budget deficit and worsening inflation will make rates keep Climbing, the majority has concluded, so the gloom has become pretty thiCk on the fixedincome side of Wall Street.

title: Koch Says Police Have Increased Sick Leave Since Cut in Days Off
description: Mayor Koch said yesterday that policemen were taking more sick days since their numbers of days off was decreased, but he was unable to provide statistics to document the finding.

title: Fairfield 92, Bonnies 81
description: FAIRFIELD, Conn., Feb. 20 (AP)Mark Young scored 24 points, all in the second half, and Joe DeSantis had 23 tonight, as Fairfield defeated St. Bonaventure, 9281. The game marked high points for the Stags and for Young. The victory raised Fairfield's record to 203, the first time the university's team recorded 20 victories since the school entered Division I in 1965. Young entered the game needing 9 points to reach the 1,000point career total.

title: President's New Stance Exercising More Power
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20Slowly but inexorably, the press of events, notably the coal crisis and some severe Congressional setbacks, has compelled President Carter to revise his views of the Presidency. Although still wary of the pitfalls or an imperial Presidency, the Administration has discovered that a less lordly Presidency, with a Minimal exercise of power, also has its risks.

title: POLICEMAN IN INQUIRY AN APPARENT SUICIDE
description: A 44yearold police officer, one of two policemen accused in an anonymous letter of taking beer and wine from Gracie Mansion last month and then getting drunk on their post outside the Mayor's official residence, was found shot to death yestetday in his Queens apartment.

title: About New York
description: Last October, after five years of frustration, LarsEric Lindblad, a silvery Scandinavian who has made an exotic luxury of wanderlust, received a message that the People's Republic of China finally was ready for posh Americans.

title: Annual Meeting of J. P. Stevens Is Set in South for the First Time
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 20J. P.'Stevens & Company, the textile producer embroiled in a bitter struggle with organized labor, has decided to hold its annual meeting outside the Northeast for the first time in its 165year history. The March 7 meeting of stockholders is to be held Instead in Greenville, S.C., where the company is a major employer with 18 plants and some 9,000 workers.

title: Settlements Debate Opened by Israelis; Cabinet Is Divided
description: JERUSALEM, Feb. 20Amid signs of divisions within the Israeli Government, the Cabinet began a debate today on the controversial policy concerning Jewish settlement in occupied Arab lands.

title: CYPRUS WASN'T TOLD OF COMMANDOS' AIM
description: CAIRO, Feb. 20Egyptian officials conceded today that their Government did not specifically tell Cyprus yesterday that commandos were on their way by Egyptian military plane for a rescue raid at an airport in Cyprus where two Arab gunmen held 15 hostages aboard a commandeered jetliner.

title: Aimy 74, Manhattan 58
description: WEST POINT, N.Y., Feb. 20 (AP)Army reeled off the first 12 points of the second half and went on to crush Manhattan, 7458, tonight. The triumph virtually assured the Cadets a spot in the. Eastern College Metropolitan Division playoffs.

title: MODELL'S IS FACING QUADRUPLED RENTAL
description: One of New York city's longume sports discount stores that has been paying bargain basement rents to the city for 13 years has been notified that the city wants to quadruple its current rent to $13,000 a month.

title: Joseph Paymer, Rabbi Emeritus Who Served for 64 Years, at 92
description: Joseph H. Peymer, Rabbi Emeritus at Congregation Ahavath Achim, 151 Woodruff Avenue, Brooklyn, died Sunday in the Royal Palm Hotel, Miami Beach, during a visit. Hp was 92 years old, lived at 29 Chester Court, Brooklyn, and was reported to have been a rabbi 64 years.

title: A.F.L.C.I.O. Calls on Congress To Increase Public Works Jobs
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Feb. 20The American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations, arguing that the Carter Administration's economic program is inadequate to the nation's employment needs, called on Congress today to double the planned number of public service and public works jobs this year.

title: Politician in India Retiring
description: NEW DELHI, Feb. 20 (AP)Jaya Prakash Narayan, the 75yearold elder statesman of the ruling Janata Party, announced yesterday that he was retiring from public responsibilities because of failing health. He said his general advice and guidance, whatever its worth, will be available to all. Mr. Narayan had kidney failure after his imprisonment in 1975 for organizing a passive resistance campaign against Prime Minister Indira Gandhi.

title: Dr. John Anthony Brown, at 59, President of Muskingum College
description: Dr. John Anthony Brown, the president of Muskingum College in New Concord, Ohio, died Thursday of a heart ailment at a St. Louis hospital, He was 59 years old.

title: Article 1 -- No Title
Holiday Celebrators March While Store Customers Stand and Wait
description: The bluest knees since Valley Forge were in the Washington's Birthday parade up Fifth Avenue yesterday. They belonged to the young women members of the St. Benedict's School Fife and Drum Corps from the Bronx, largest of the musical groups in the 78th annual Knights of Columbus march to St. Patrick's Cathedral for a memorial mass, at which Terence Cardinal Cooke, Archbishop of New York, presided.

title: Oldwick Acts to Save Old Farm
description: OLDWICKResidents of this semi rural Hunterdon County area have pledged money and property toward the purchase of an old farm and to save 400 acres from development.

title: Foe of Canal Accord Asks Senate to Seek New Defense Rights
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (AP) The Senate resumed debate on the Panama. Canal treaties today with a leading opponent urging approval of an amendment giving the United States the right to maintain troops in Panama, if the President finds it necessary, after the year 2000, when Panama would gain full control of the waterway.

title: DOLLAR IN A PLUNGE TO NEW LOW LEVELS IN EUROPEAN TRADING
description: PARIS, Feb. 20The dollar fell record lows against other major Western currencies in Europe today, highlighting the dilemma European monetary officials say the Carter Administration now faces in setting American exchangerate policy.

title: Ohio Gun Dealer Is Shot to Death By His Son After Killing a Friend
description: AKRON, Ohio, Feb. 20 (AP)A gun dealer killed a friend and attacked his own family before he was shot to death by his son, the police said. Officials said that George Loveless, 38 years old, of ncarby Barberton, opened fire yesterday on an Akron home where his wife and two children were visiting.

title: MuscleBuilder Will Try To Put Punch Into Mets
description: The Mets have not been known as a team with much muscle in recent years, but if Paul Mastropasqua has anything to say this season, the muscle they possess will be well toned and in fine working order.

title: NEEDIEST CASES FUND HELD HEART WARMING
description: It Is heart wasrming to read that someone cares for our less fortunate persons, Christine M. Frumusa of Tinton Falls, N. J., wrote with her donation of $10 to the 66th annual appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: Moorhead Sees Congress Debating Down to Wire on Aid to New York
description: WASHINGTON, Feb, 20Congress may go down to the wire in June before deciding the controversial question of continued Federal loan assistance to New York City, said Representative William S. Moorhead, Democrat of Pennsylvania and head of a House panel considering the matter.

title: Snowbound Siberian State Farm Sits Out 6Month Winter
description: CHIK, U.S.S.R.Winter buries the 79,000 acres of the Chik State Farm under a sea of snow whose undulating swells stretch endlessly across the Siberian plain. The snow started falling in October; it will not melt until April.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: Cosmos Coach Lauds Young Players
description: MIAMI, Feb. 20The sleek gray l incusino sped toward the south end of the city, followed by two vans full of Cosmos on the way to their training sessions today.

title: CALIFORNIA AIDE PROMISE ACTION IN TOWN BLACKOUT
description: WESTWOOD, Calif., Feb. 20 (AP)The lights in this lumber town were to go back on today, but one state official promised to keep pressure on the electric company that provoked residents to a selfimposed blackout. Most of Westwood's 2,500 residents turned off their electricity Feb. 12 in protest of rate increates.

title: Article 2 -- No Title
4th French Film Festival Starts at Modern March 2
description: Nine recent feature films and two programs of shorts will have their American premieres during the fourth Annual PerspectiVes of French Cinema, at the Museum of Modern Art March 2 to 14.

title: Marquette Romps, 7553, Over Xavier
description: CINCINNATI, Feb. 20 (AP)  Secondranked Marquette, with Butch Lee becoming the school's No. 3 career scorer, won its seventh straight game with a 7553 victory over Xavier (Ohio) University tonight.

title: UNIVERSITY'S HOSPITAL WINS NEW ACCREDITATION
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 20 (AP)Temple University Hospital, threatened with loss of accreditation last fall, has been accredited for one year by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Hospitals, the university said today.

title: 7 Die in SouthWest Africa Clash
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Feb, 20 (Reuters)Four South African soldiers and a civilian air force worker were killed by guerrillas in two separate incidents in SouthWest Africa yesterday, Defense Headquarters announced today. It said two guerrillas were also killed and an unknown number wounded.

title: Chronology of Events in Cyprus
description: Noon: Two gunmen burst into the lobby of the Hilton Hotel here and fatally shoot Yousef elSebai, editor of the Egyptian newspapef Al Ahram and secretary general of the AfroAsian Pepples' Solidarity Organization meeting here. The gunmen take 30 hostages, mostly conference delegates, and take refuge in a hotel restaurant.

title: Despite Diplomatic and Battle Scars, P. L. O is the Palestinians' Only Voice
description: AMMAN, JordanSince Yasir Arafat addressed the United Nations General Assembly on Nov. 13, 1974, the Palestine Liberation Organization he heads has attained an impressive degree of international recognition and has put the Palestinian question high on the agenda for a Middle East settlement.

title: Pop: Big Voice
description: Patti Austin, who was at the Bottom Line over the weekend, is a bigvoiced singer of funk and jazz whose poise and musicality reflect a professional background as a backup and jingle singer. But while many professionals with similar credentials put lyrics over with the soul and feeling of toothpaste salesmen, Miss Austin is at her best with a lyric that requires emoting. In a manner that is sometimes reminiscent of Cissy Houston, she is able to take overworked pop staples and make them fresh and relevant to her listeners.

title: Bomb Found at Nonunion Mine
description: NORTON, Va., Feb. 20 (AP)A bomb was found today at a nonunion coal mine, but it failed to explode because its flashlight battery detonator apparently was dead. the state police said. Leonard Hill, a truck driver for the Paramount Coal Company, and his partner found the device wired to the gate at the company mine near here.

title: CORRECTION
description: Because of a typographical error, it incorrectly stated in. The New York. Times on Saturday that Robert J. Smith had been named acting head of Downe Communications Inc, Mr. Smith is acting head of the broadcasting group at Downe, replacing George Wilson, wh resigned.

title: NEW BAN ON FOREIGN SHIPS IN LOBSTER GROUNDS URGED
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., Feb. 20 (AP)Some angry fishermen, who say they have lost thousands, of dollars from foreign, boats coming into their lobster beds, want the Federal Government to reimpose the 100mile limit for foreign fishing vessels.

title: Pewter Shows Its Mettle
description: Pewter, the metal our colonial ancestors used extensively for tableware, has mare a comeback in the 70's. Once known as poor man's silver, it has been taken up by the major silver companies as a hedge against the high cost of sterling. Undoubtedly some of the present popularity of pewter is due to the interest on our past generated by the Bicentennial.

title: Administration Says It Lacks A Liquefied Gas Import Policy
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20 (AP)The Carter Administration told Congress today it still did not have a clear, writtendown policy for regulating liquefied natural gas imports, even though a mishap could cause what one House member called potentially a very large disaster.

title: A Flute Recital by Bonita Boyd
description: Bonita Boyd's flute recital sunday night at Alice Tully Hallpart of the Eastman Series of performances featuring faculty members at the Eastman School of Music in Rochester  was a cleverly varied event, in terms of musical styles and in combinations or instruments. The variety wasn't enough to avoid the monotony of hearing a flute play throughout a long program, however.

title: Chamber Group Proves Flexible
description: One of the advantages of a chamber orchestra of some two dozen players like the Endymion Ensemble is its flexibility in exploring works that often get bypassed because of their unusual instrumentation. At its Carnegie Recital Hall concert Saturday afternoon, the group offered four especially attractive works of this type.

title: Roy Cohn, at 51, Enjoys Prosperity And Controversy
description: Roy M. Cohn turned 51 years old yesterday, and the enfant terrible of the McCarthy era is very much the center of controversy, as he has always been.

title: Radio
description: 78 A.M., WNCN. Resolution, Dowland; Concerto Grosso, Geminiani; Canon in D, Pachelbel; A Mighty Fortress is Our God, Bach; Concerto No. 1 for 5 Flutes, Boismortier; Sinfonia from Jephtha, Handel.

title: Tapanese Lumber Giant Bankrupt As 5 Big Banks Remove Support
description: TOKYO, Feb. 20The Eidai Sangyo Company, Japan's largest plywrood manufacturer and a major homebuilder, declared bankruptcy. today, in what Is believed to be this nation s. second largest cornorate insolvency since World War II.

title: Roy Cohn, at 51, Enjoys Prosp erity And Controversy
description: Roy M. Cohn turned 51 years old yesterday, and the enfant terrible of the McCarthy era is very much the center of controversy, as he has always been.

title: Around the Nation
description: CASTLE DALE, Utah, Feb. 20 (UPI)Angry wives of itinerant construction) workers struck back today al what they say follows them around the nation price gauging by residents of the small towns where they work.

title: Atlanta Inquiry Finds Some Blacks Got Advance Look at Police Exams
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 20After a 14week inquiry, a team of special investigators reported tonight that selected black policemen had been permitted an advance look at promotion examinations by Public Safety Commissioner Reginald A. Eaves, the, first black to head Atlanta's police and fire departments,

title: Wreck OH Cape Cod Called Missing Vessel
description: PROVINCETOWN, Mass., Feb. 20 (AP)A wreck discovered off the tip of.Cape Cod has been identified as the Captain Bill, a trawler missing with a crew of four men, Wayne Sullivan, a diver, made the identification. yester day after diving 130 feet in rough seas to check on wreckage discovered by a Provincetown fishing boat Saturday.

title: Market Place
description: Real estate is booming todaya little like the stock market of the late 1960's. Everyone, it seems, wants to participate in the investment arena, which takes up to 40 percent of the nation's savings flow.

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, FEBRUARY 21, 1978

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Dinosaur: Coldblooded Failure or Hotblooded Success?
description: Dinosaurs, the extinct giants so familiar in children's books and museum exhibits, are at the center of a raging controversy among paleontologists who are reviving a decadesold debate over just what kind of animals dinosaurs were.

title: Advertising
description: Nobody ever said you can't teach an old camel new tricks. R. J. Reynolds already did it once and is now about to try again.

title: The U.N. Today
CHURCH COUNCIL WEIGHING MOVING FROM SWITZERLAND
description: GENEVA, Feb. 20The World Council of Churches disclosed, today that it was considering moving its headquarters out of Switzerland because of the negative impact on its finances of the fall in value of the United States dollar and the West German mark in terms of Swiss francs.

title: Issue and Debate Who Should Be Held Liable for Skiing Injuries?
description: When Gov. Richard A. Snelling of Vermont recently signed into law a bill defining in part the source of liability in ski accident cases, the operators of the state's 26 major ski areas breathed easier, As did the two insurance firms that underwrite liability policies. The bill has lessened considerably the chances of a jury making another award of $1.5 million in damages to an injured skier, as happened in a Vermont Superior Court in Burlington last June.

title: Harlem Group In Premieres Of 2 Dances
description: During a varied weekend of dance, audiences could see Dance Theater of Harlem in three new works and, on Sunday afternoon, cast changes in the New York City Ballet's Don Quixote.

title: Insect Seizes Prey's Covering to Foil Its Own Foes
description: An insect that tears fuzzy material from its prey to become a wolf in sheep's clothing has been discovered by Cornell University researchers. Thus disguised, it feeds among its victims, unmolested by their ant defenders.

title: Deaths
description: ABRAMSHarold. Beloved husband of Nettie. Devoted father of Jerome Abrams & Eileen Ratner. Dearest grandfather of Mark, Jonathan, Scott, Roy, Lori & Margie. Services Wednesday, 1PM, Schwartz Brothers, Forest Park Chapels Queens Boulevard & 76th Road, Forest Hills.

title: Atherton to Be Envoy at Large
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20 (Reuters)The State Department announced today that President Carter intended to nominate Alfred L. Atherton Jr., 56 years old, to be ambassador at large.with special responsibility for Middle East peace negotiations. He is now Assistant Secretary of State for Near Eastern and South Asian Affairs. Harold H. Saunders, director of the Bureau of Intelligence and Research, will succeed Mr. Atherton.

title: EAST GERMAN SAYS WEST INCREASES WAR'S DANGER
description: EAST BERLIN, Feb. 20Erich Honecker, head of East Germany's Communist Party, accused the West today of intensifying the arms race in a manner unparalleled in history and said new Western military potentials increased the dangers of a war.

title: Carter Continues Campaign Duty With Trip to Delaware for Senator
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Feb. 20President Carter today continued his campaign for this, year's Democratice candidates with brief appearances here in behalf of Senator Joseph Biden.

title: U.S. AGENCY QUESTIONS USE OF CANCER FUNDS
description: OMAHA, Feb. 20The blankcheck days for cancer research are ending, for a number of reasons, among them Federal fiscal constraints, the lack of solid progress against the disease and the way that such laboratories as Omaha's Eppley Institute for Research on Cancer spend money.

title: Bergonzi in a Demanding Recital
description: Carlo Bergonzi is such an engaging recitalist that it seems odd that he waited until last March to give his New York concert debut. The occasion was such a success that the tenor returned to Avery Fisher Hall Sunday afternoon, with the admirable John Wustman at the piano, and presented another program of songs and arias, all greeted with vociferous approval by the audience.

title: Terrorism: Palestinians Ambivalent About Issue
description: To some, the very word Palestinian is a synonym for terrorist. Yet the number of Palestinians who have engaged in terrorist acts is small and the number of ordinary Palestinians who approve of international terrorism such as hijackingis smaller today than it used to be.

title: Article 5 -- No Title
Dominach Joins Bache March 13; To Be in Charge of Operations
description: Bathe Halsey Stuart Shields Inc. announced yesterday that Frank E. Dominach Jr., 46yearold member of the executive committee at Loeb Rhoades Hornblower & Company, would join. Bache as executive vice president in charge of operations. effective March 13.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Rutgers Wins Title In Track
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Feb. 20Franklin Jacobs won a title with one jump, Kevin Price survived two disqualifications, and two sprinters claimed the 60yard dash crown.

title: 50,000 Vans and Pickup Trucks Recalled in Ford Check of Sprin??
description: DETROIT, Feb. 20 (UPI)The For Motor Company announced the recall to day of nearly 50,000 1978 vans and. picl up trucks for inspection of a spring the may prevent the vehicle from lockir into the park position.

title: RHODESIANS SHOOT BACK OVER MOZAMBIQUE BORDER
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Feb. 20 (AP)Rhodesian security forces were shelled from Mozambique today and later retaliated, reports from the area said.

title: Canadians Support A 56Inch Pipeline For Natural Gas
description: OTTAWA, Feb. 20The National Energy Board of Canada recommended today that the Canadian portion of the $1 billion naturalgas pipeline to northern Alaska be 56 inches in diameter, a size readily made by steel producers in Canada but not by American mills.

title: Marijuana Seizures Tripled on Turnpike
description: The New Jersey state police said yesterday that the amount of marijuana confiscated on the New Jersey Turnpike was three times greater in 1977 than in 1976.

title: The Cruel Hoax of HumphreyHawkins
description: The nation's. newest Senater, Muriel Hurnphreyi will introduce a bill this week that bears her late husband's name. The HumphreyHawkins bill, with its nominal promise of full employment and balanced economic growth, now seems ,almost unassailable.. After. several false starts in Congress, it will in all likelihood pass this year.

title: High School Winning Battle Against Bats
description: SAVANNAH, Ga., Feb. 20 (AP)Richard Mole, principal of Beach High School, where staff members and pupils have killed about 700 bats this month, said today that he believed that humans were winning the battle against the flying mammals.

title: Leonard Silk
description: The 11weekold coal strike, Which is already causing electric pawer cutbacks, plant closings, short workweeks and cold homes and offices, should give the national, debate over energy policy a renewed sense of reality and urgency. For the strike is a fresh reminder of how vulnerable the United States is to any interruption of energy supplies, not just in the, long run but right now.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: TV: Question Of Guilt Asks: :Did she Slay?
description: Women who wear sexy blond wigs dop't necessarily go around murdering their children. That's the brief message of a seemingly endless television movie called A Question of Guilt. .Obviously inspired by the case of Alice Crimmins in New York, the film can be seen at 9 o'clock tonight on CBSTV.

title: Schumer Releases Records That State Hospital Was at Fault in Death of Five
description: Assemblyman Charles E. Schumer said yesterday that Queens Hospital Center memorandums showed the five patients there died in 1976 because of mismanagement, overcrowding and nursing shortages.

title: Brown Says U.S. Will Strengthen Its Forces in Asia
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 20Defense Secretary Harold Brown said tonight that the Carter Administration was planning to strengthen its strategic forces in Asia and upgrade the Pacific Fleet because of growing Soviet military strength in the region.

title: Postcards And the Vox Pop
description: On a single day not long before the House of Representatives voted on whether to continue development of the B1 bomber; a Midwestern member received 400 postcards on the subject. All were printed on.blue, green or pink cards; all were postmarked from the same town in the Congressman's district; all urged the bomber's development.

title: Syracuse 109, Fordham 62
description: SYRACUSE, Feb. 20Syracuse, using a 13point burst during a 278 spree late in the first half, routed Fordham, 10962, tonight in the Manley Field House.

title: Economic Signals Could Lead to Halt In Bond Price Drop
description: Bond prices declined and yields rose last week, but many investment bankers and credit market analysts speculated that these trends may have run their course for a while.

title: Reports of Child Abuse Prompt Investigation at Michigan Center
description: NORTHVILLE, Mich., Feb. 20 (AP)Reports of child abuse and torture at a home for retarded youngsters have prompted Gov. William G. Milliken to order an investigation. State officials acknowledge that scattered abuses may have occurred.

title: Jane Blalock Takes Golf By 2 Shots
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb. 20 (UPI) Jane Blalock won the $60,000 Orange Blossoni Classic today with a final round of 70 in Cold weather and intermittent rain. She had a 54hole score of fourunderpar 212.

title: 5,000 Rally Against Torrijos
description: COLON, Panama, Feb. 20 (AP)About 5,000 opponents of Omar Torrijos Herrera, the Panamanian leader, jammed a small park yesterday for the largest rally against the general since ne seized power in 1968. They demanded that the Government allow exiles to return, increase political freedom and allow outlawed political parties to operate legally again.

title: Toward Spring
description: Even if February should end in a snowstorm and March come in like a lion and roar for a while, there are already signs that winter is running out of breath. Red osier dogwood sterns begin to look more lively, red against the snow than they did a month ago. Willow catkins are still wintertight, but the withes have a touch of amber. There are a few winter robins around, and even a few redwinged blackbirds, and they now seem to be watching for the arrival of their migrant cousins, still down south of the frostline. In sheltered bops here and there the primitive hoods of timedefying skunk cabbage have melted their wag up through the ice. And here and there maple sap is flowing; traditionally the flow begins around the time: of WashIngton's birthday, for the trees set their clocks', by the sun, not the calendar.

title: JANE LUTNICK
description: Jane Lutnick, former president of the Art League of Long Island, died Sunday in her home on Kirby Lane, Muthontown, L.I. She was 42 years old.

title: POLICEMAN IN INQUIRY AN APPARENT SUICIDE
description: A 44yearold police officer, one of two policemen accused In an anonymous letter of taking beer and wine from Gracie Mansion last month and then getting drunk on their post outside the Mayor's official residence, was found shot to death yesterday in his Queens apartment.

title: Winkler Takes Nordic Title
description: LAHTI, Finland, Feb. 20 (AP)Konrad Winkler of East Germany turned in a steady 15kilometer crosscountry race today to win the combined title in the world Nordic ski championships. It was the second gold medal for the East Germans in four events so far.

title: Centers to Aid Blizzard Victims
description: PORTSMOUTH, N.H., Feb. 20 (AP)Disaster aid centers, will be set up tomorrow in Hampton and Rye to help New Hampshire's coastal residents begin rebuilding after this month's blizzard. The region was declared a disaster area by President Carter last week.

title: SYNTEX EARNINGS ROSE 34% IN FISCAL QUARTER
description: The Syntex Corporation, a manufacturer of drugs, hospital equipment and agricultural chemicals, announced yesterday that earnings for the second quarter of its 1978 fiscal year climbed to $12.6 million, 34 percent more than in the preceding year's period.

title: Carey Leads Cheers at Democratic Dinner
description: Governor Carey played the role of political cheerleader last night at a Democratic dinnner that raised $250,000 for the campaign to increase the party's hold on the New York State Legislature next year.

title: U.S. AGENCY QUESTIONS USE OF CANCER FUNDS
description: OMAHA, Feb. 20The blankcheck days for cancer research are ending, for a number of reasons, among them Federal fiscal constraints, the lack of solid progress against the disease and the way that such laboratories as Omaha's Eppley Institute for Research on Cancer spend money.

title: Mideast Peace Drive: Pessimism in Israel
description: JERUSALEM, Feb, 20Officials of the Government of Prime Minister Menachem Begin are saying that the IsraeliEgyptian negotiations, with the United States acting as an intermediary, will continue, but they are pessimistic as to how far they can go toward securing peace in the Middle East.

title: Koch Retreats From Charge Banks Blackmailed City to Get Deposits
description: Mayor Koch retreated yesterday from his charge, made Sunday, that banks had blackmailed New York City into depositing city funds in interestfree accounts to prevent the closing of bank branches.

title: Christians and Jews Recall Their Joint Victories
description: The pictures showed New York's Governor, Alfred E. Smith, at the opening of the Holland Tunnel. But when he campaigned for President in 1928, the first time a Roman Catholic had done so, some Georgia Protestant churches exhibited the pictures to suggest that the tunnel was to connect with the basement of the Vatican in Rome.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The Wiss Company has announced plans to relocate most of its handcutting toolmanufacturing operations from Newark and Maplewood to North Carolina because of lower taxes and cheaper labor. The company, which has been in Newark since 1848, plans to continue operations in Newark for 125 of its 850 employees. Most Of the New Jersey operation will be phased out over the next 18 months.

title: L.I.U. 82, Centenary 81
description: Kim Malcolm scored with eight seconds left and lifted L.I.U. over Centenary College, 82.81, last night at the Blackbirds court. Trailing 49.43 at the half, L.I.U. (8.16) took a 6260 lead with 11:27 remaining on a field goal by Humberto Roberts, who with. Malcolm led L.I.U. scorers with 18 points each. L.I.U., however, lost that lead and did not regain it until Malcolm scored the winner.

title: Regents and Rev. Moon
description: The New York State Board of Regents routinely approves dozens of charters for educational institutions each year. But the action the Regents will take tomorrow on a charter request by the Rev. Sun Myung Moon's Unification Theological seminary could change the way in which the board considers all such requests in the future.

title: Mother Dies After Saving Child
description: MILWAUKEE, Feb. 20 (UPI)A mother saved her 3yearold son from a f ire today by dropping him from the window of a thirdfloor apartment into the arms of a rescuer but could not get out herself. The woman, identified as Elaine Dabney, 24 years old, of Memphis, Tenn., died in the fire that raced through the Hilltop Arms building. Her son, Rodney, was in stable condition at Children's Hospital.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: FOOD FOR THOUGHT The public is invited today to hear some wisdom on gastronomy and wine from a battery of experts assembled among the bookshelves of Brentano's, Fifth Avenue hptwepn 47th and 48th Streets, from 3:30 to 6 P.M. Such cooking authorities and writers as James Beard, Craig Claiborne, Pierre Franey, Michel Guerard and Robert Carrier will hold forth and answer questions from the audience, with the panel chaired by Clifton Fadinian, a literature aid wine Cicpett, along the lines of television's Information Please format. The culinary crew will also be available to autograph copies of their new books.

title: Dinosaur: Coldbiooded Failure or Hotblooded Success?
description: Dinosaurs, the extinct giants so familiar in children's books and museum exhibits, are at the center of a raging controversy among paleontologists who are reviving a decadesold debate over just what kind of animals dinosaurs were.

title: Fire Destroys Atlantic City Hotel
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Feb. 20 (UPI)The Delaware Hotel was destroyed by fire last night, but no injuries were reported, according to the police. The threestory hotel, situated on Tennessee Avenue, was closed for the season.

title: Berman Recital March 5
description: Lazar Berman, whose recital on Jan 22 at Avery Fisher Hall had to be postnoned because of illness, will appear instead on March 5 at 8 P.M. The Russian pianist will play works by Shostakovich, Liszt and Prokofiev. Tickets bearing the Jan: 22 date will be honored March 5.

title: Q&A
description: Q. In many Chinese recipes, fresh ginger is called for. I have bought it by the pound and often have a large amount left. What is the recommended way to keep fresh ginger so that it does not dry up or rot? I keep mine briefly in the vegetable hin of the refrigerator.

title: Wine Talk
description: MOST chauvinistic wine arguments take on the aura of the old my father can lick your father challenge. Which means they produce a great deal of heat and very little light. Is Stag's Leap cabernet sauvignon better than Chateau LafiteRothschild? Is our Chateau MonteIona chardonnay really superior to their BatardMontrachet? Whatever the answer, it is nice to see both sides rolling around on the floor together, battling it out.

title: A School Board Spurns Job Aid Limited to Poor
description: In what some residents are calling middleclass revolt, a Queens school district has refused to participate in Federal jobs program because the program would have benefited only poor children, most of whom are bused into the community, and not its middleincome youngsters.

title: Texas Ranger Is Shot to Death
description: DENTON, Tex., Feb. 21 (AP)A Texas Ranger was shot dead last nightthe first in 47 years. Bobby Paul Doherty was gunned down as he was standing guard behind house near this north central Texas town, the Rangers say.

title: West Germany Is Now No. 1 As Soviet Capitalist Trader
description: MOSCOWIn his 1916 pamphlet, Imperialism: The Highest Stage of Capitalism, V. I. Lenin described the German electrotechnical giant A.E.G. as a huge combine that had invested 62 million marks in Russia by the turn of the century. The capitalists divide the world, Lenin wrote, not out of any particular malice, but in order to get profits.

title: CarbonFiltration System to Test For Carcinogens in Passaic River
description: CLIFTON, Feb. 21Samples from the Passaic River, which provides drinking water fer 330,000 residents of 15 communities, will be put through a special carbonfiltration system to determine if it contains possible cancercausing elements, an cfficial of the Passaic Valley Water Commission said here today.

title: Soviet Explosion Kills Miners
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 21 (AP)A methane gas explosion at the Sokur mine of the Karaganda coal basin in Soviet Kazakhstan killed and injured an unspecified number of miners yesterday, the Tess press agency reported today. The disclosure came indirectly in a government message of condolences to the next kin

title: About Education
description: An indepth picture of what City University looks like seven years after ending its selective admissions policy has emerged in a, new report on the characteristics of the institution's undergraduates.

title: Stage: Prize Story Takes New Form
description: IN TILLIE OLSEN'S short. story Tell Me a Riddle, an aging married couple find that old harmonies are not enough to outweigh old grievances. Their marriage Is encrusted with years of envy, anxiety and aggravation. When the husband discovers that his wife is dying, he is suddenly confronted with the emptiness of his own existence.

title: Radio Music
description: 78 A.M., WNCN. Danse Macabre,SaintSans; Partita No. 5, Bach; Trio in B flat, Schubert; Donna Diana Overture, Reznicek.

title: ETHIOPIA SENDS U.S. PROMISE ON SOMALIA
description: WASHINGTON. Feb. 21  The White House said today that the head of Ethiopia's military Government had sent personal assurances to President Carter that. Ethiopian forces would neither invade neighboring Somalia nor interfere in the internal affairs of any adjoining countries.

title: How to Take Care of Your Teeth
description: Here are some tips on tooth care from the American Dental Association.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY TransAtlantic

title: Dance: Les Ballets Jazz Makes New York Debut
description: LES BALLETS JAZZ from Montreal is worth a saunter down to the Roundabout Theater at 333 West 23d Street, where the Canadian company made its New York debut last night. Still another Canadian dance company! Within the last year, these small troupes seem to have sprung fullblown upon the city's stages. One sees the fine hand of creative government subsidy if not creative impetus behind this sudden growth of Canadian dance, With the aid of the Canada Council, these., groups have proliferated both rapidly and recently. Apparently, they want to be seen in New York.

title: Around the Nation
description: CASTAIC, Calif., Feb. 21 (AP)A jail infirmary was burned to the ground and at least six barracks were ransacked by up to 300 prison farm inmates when a fistfight developed into a fullscale riot last night.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL Seton Hall vs. St. Peter's and. Fordham vs. Manhattan at Madison Square Garden, Eighth Avenue and 33d Street. First game, 7 P.M.

title: Ryllis Barnes Simpson, 79, Dancer for Florenz Ziegfeld
description: Ryllis Barnes Simpson, who was a featured dancer for Florenz Ziegfeld in 1922 on the New Amsterdam Roof in New York and later served as a foreignservice officer for the State Department, died Saturday in Lenox Hill Hospital after a long illness. She was 79 years old and lived at 185 East 85th Street.

title: Steel Output Up to 2.4 Million Tons For Increase of 3.9% in Week
description: Steel production for the week ended, Feb. 18 rose to 2.4 million tons, up .3.9 percent from the preceding week, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday. The industry. produced 2.3 million tons in the week earlier.

title: A Mate Bought For Seattle Slew
description: OCALA, Fla., Feb. 21 (AP) Desert Vixen, twotime Eclipse Award winner who is in foal to What A Pleasure, was purchased for $700,000 yesterday by Franklin N. Graves of Minneapolis at the Ocala Breeders Sales.

title: Irwin Shaw Tells Writers: Grab the Ball and Run
description: Like the hero of his famous snort story The 80Yard Run, Irwin Shaw returned for the first time to his alma mater yesterday.

title: Ineligible Columbia Wrestler Appeals N.C.A.A. Ban
description: A Columbia University student who is a member of the Unification Church is appealing a decision by the National Collegiate Athletic Association that makes him ineligible to compete for the Columbia wrestling team.

title: Harvard 96, Brandeis 91
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Feb. 21 (AP)Brandeis's Walt Harrigan scored 40 points, but Harvard had five men in double figures and gained a 9691 victory tonight.

title: Meany Drops Bid for Trade Bill, Asks Moves to Protect Workers
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Feb. 21The A.F.L.C.I.O. today abandoned its advocay of a comprehensive protectionist trade bill and called instead for a series of legislative steps to shield American workers from foreign competition.

title: Article 1 -- No Title
60Minute Gourmet
description: SOME of the finest dining in the United States can occur right in the middle of winter because some of the finest, freshest fish come from the cold waters of the Atlantic along about now.

title: Girl, 13, Shot Dead In a Bronx Hallway
description: A 13yearold girl was shot to death in the hallway of a Bronx apartment building at, 9:45 last night, according to the police, and an 18yearold youth was promptly arrested and charged with the crime.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The Atlantic City Prosecutor's office said it hoped a snow shovel could turn out to be a clue in the killing of former Judge ]Edwin H. Helant. ].. said It would circulate a photograph of the shovel. which wa:a carried by the killer who shot Mr. Helfant at the Flamingo. Motel cocktail lounge last Wednesday.

title: Koch Soliciting Advice On Switch to Limousine From Deathtrap Car
description: Mayor Koch says he would like to start using a cityowned Cadillac limousine, but first would like to hear whether the public thanks that is a good idea.

title: Dummar, in Court, Gives His Version Of Hughes Contact
description: LAS VEGAS, Feb. 21 (AP)Meivin Dummar, the mechanic cited as an heir an a document purported to be the will of Howard R. Hughes, stood before a jury today and drew a picture of the road near a brothel where., he contends that he befriended the late industrialist in 1967.

title: Peter Paul Purchase Planned by Cadbury
description: Cadbury Schweppes Ltd., the British candy and beverage company, is purchasing Peter Paul Inc., the American candy bar producer, for about $58 million in cash, Peter Paul announced yesterday. .

title: BLUMENTHAL PRESSES ALBANY FOR APLEDGE ON NEV YORK CITY AID
description: ALBANY, Feb. 21Treasury Secretary W. Michael Blumenthal pressed Governor Carey and the legislative leaders today to commit themselves to state aid to New York City that would grow in the years ahead beyond the $200 million they have already agreed upon for next year.

title: SENATE PANEL OPENS HEARING ON CIVILETTI
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21The Senate Judiciary Committee began hearings today on President Carter's nomination of Benjamin R. Civiletti to be Deputy Attorney General, with the panel's Republican minority expected to delve into various Justice Department controversies.

title: CRACKDOWN ON DRUGS PROMISED IN HARLEM
description: Responding to the demands of a group of Harlem clergymen, Police Commissioner Robert J. McGuire announced yesterday he would put more men and money into their community to combat what he called the staggering drug problem. The Commissioner was not specific, but he said slowing the narcotics traffic in Harlem would be the Police Department's top priority.

title: Technology
description: As Federal controls on air and water pollution continue to tighten, cells grow louder for balancing the costs of the controls against estimated economic benefits from improved human health.

title: About Education
description: An indepth picture of what City University looks like seven years after ending its selective admissions policy has emerged in a new report on the characteristics of the institution's undergraduates.

title: Coal Operators Refuse to Accept Pact as Model
description: WASHINGTON, Wednesday, Feb. 22The nation's major coal companies this morning rejected as a model for a strike settlement the contract announced Monday between the United Mine Workers and the Pittsburg and Midway Coal Company, an independent mine operator.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Roxanne Gay of Gloucester Township, N.J., was declared competent to stand trial in the stabbing death of her husband, Blenda Gay, who played professional football for the Philadelphia Eagles.

title: New Representative From Bronx
description: Promptly at 7 o'clock on the morning after his election by an unexpectedly large margin over four other candidates to represent the South Bronx in Congress, Robert Garcia stood at the busy subway entrance alongside

title: Cypriot Chief Asks Sadat to Meet on Repairing Ties
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Feb. 21President Spyros Kyprianou of Cyprus today urged President Anwar elSadat of Egypt to meet with him to try to rebuild the relations between their countries that were shattered by the bloody shootout at Larnaca airport on Sunday when 15 Egyptian commandos were killed by Cypriot national guardsmen.

title: Balancing the Investment in Humans
description: ALBANYTwo years ago, while I was president of Michigan State University, I was visited by a minority student who was majoring in chemical engineering. No one in her family had AVAr attended college before she did. She was a fullneed student with a small scholarship, a parttime job, and a Government loanall components of what we somewhat euphemistically call a financial aid package.

title: HIGH COURT TO RULE ON PENSION DENIAL BY TEAMSTER FUND
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21The Supreme Court agreed today to decide whether members of collectively bargained, employerfinanced pension funds are entitled to the same amount of information about them as stockholders buying securities.

title: China Says 4 Radicals Will Not Be Executed
description: TOKYO, Feb. 21 (AP)The Gang of Four disgraced radical leaders will be allowed to live despite their unrepentant attitude since being arrested on charges of trying to seize power, China's official press agency Hsinhua said today.

title: The Rev. Edward Killion, 77,W as the Vatican Aide To U.N. From 47 to 53
description: The Rev. Edward J. Killion, who served as the Vatican's representative to the United Nations in Geneva from 1947 to 1953 and coordinated the resettlement of thousands of postwar refugees, died tact. Thursday at the St. John Neumann

title: Film: 2 About Youth
description: FILMS by two young black film makers make up the new program that opened yesterday at the Whitney Museum of Ameri

title: Youngster, 16, in Debut Bows to Renee Richards
description: DETROIT, Feb. 21 (AP)Nicole Lorenzetti, a 16yearold hometown favorite, was beaten by Renee Richards, 61, 62, as a $100,000 women's professional tennis tournament opened at Cobo Arena today. There was a packed house, including many of Miss Lorenzetti's Lahser High School classmates.

title: French Voters Get Wide Choice
description: PARIS, Feb. 21 (Reuters)  French voters will have a wider choice than ever before, with 4,285 candidates running in next month's general election, an average of nine for every National Assembly seat

title: Books of The Times
description: THERE comes a point in the reading of any financial guide when the mind collapses. This usually happens about the point when the book starts asking you if you've

title: A Guide to Suit Buying
description: When buying a suit, it should be remembered, that the fabric accounts for about onethird of the cost of its manufacture (the average suit requires approximately three and a half yards of fabric); workmanship accounts for the rest.

title: Berkey Photo Claims $93.4 Million In Damages by Eastman Kodak
description: Berkey Photo Inc. claimed $93.4 million in damages by the Eastman Kodak Company yesterday as the second phase of the jury trial of Berkey's antitrust suit against Kodak opened in United States District Court in Manhattan. Last month, the jury of eight women and two men found after a sixmonth trial that Kodak had unlawfully dominated many segments of the United States photographic market.

title: SOCIAL AGENCY CHIEF OUSTED ON NEPOTISM
description: The board of directors of the Congress of ItalianAmerican Organizations last night voted 8 to 1 to dismiss Mary Sansone, the executive director of the organization since its founding in the mid60's.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: THIS is a city where nothing is beyond belief. Credulity is taxed sometimes. Sometimes it is trampled upon. Sometimes it is severely tweaked. But never is it beaten into, submission. So in the presence of an apparent. miracle, in the presence of the seemingly impossible, the inclination is to believe.

title: Luszczek of Poland Wins 15Kilometer Skiing Event
description: LAHTI, Finland, Feb. 21 (AP)Jozef Luszczek rallied in the closing stages to win today's 15kilometer race at the world Nordic championships for Poland's first gold medal in major crosscountry skiing.

title: Deaths
description: AGRESSSamuel, Beloved husband of Helene. Devoted father of Ellen, Anita and Linda. Loving brother. of Harold and Edith Burd, Services were held.

title: Private Lives
description: MY SIDEKICK is transferring names and numbers from an old, brokendown telephone book to a new, squeakyclean telephone book. I am not. I am on top of the organe box, sucking cyanide from a peach pit, reading the Egyptian Book of the Dead. It is clear to me this weekend that the 60's are dead. Their license has expired. Back to back, Bella Abzug and Muhammad All went down to defeat. I am considering the ontological consequences of this fact. Perhaps we should remove the 60's from our telephone book.

title: Supreme Court Roundup College Status of Homosexual Group Left Standing
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21The Supreme Court declined today to review a lower court ruling requiring the University of Missouri to recognize Gay Lib, a student homosexual group, as an official campus organization.

title: People and Business
description: The Lloyds Bank Group announced in London yesterday the appointment of Norman Jones, currently deputy chief, to succeed Peter Piper as chief executive of the multinational banking concern, which has assets of $25 billion.

title: Rhodesian Talks Are at Impasse Over Rules for Transition Period
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Feb. 21Prime Minister Ian D. Smith and representatives !of three black groups remained at an impasse today over the composition of the transitional government that would lead to black rule. Each side insisted on havine control during the period.

title: Vachon, Goring Lead Kings to 41 Triumph
description: LANDOVER, Md., Feb. 21 (AP)Rogie Vachon had another outstanding game in the net for the Los Angeles Kings, stopping 30 shots in a 41 victorry over the Washington Capitals in the National Hockey League tonight.

title: Cosmos Get Brand, Star Goalkeeper
description: MIAMI, Feb. 21Coach Eddie Firmani of the Cosmos, a man of many surprises, found another goalkeeper this morning.

title: MRS. ABZUG CONCEDES HER DEFEAT BY GREEN
description: Conceding her defeat by S. William Green a wek after a special election for an interim term in the House of Representatives, Bella S. Abzug said yesterday that she would not try again this fall for that seat.

title: Rockets 111, Celtics 96
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 21 (UPI)Calvin Murphy and John Lucas combined for 55 points to lead the Houston Rockets to a 11196 victory tonight over the Boston Celtics.

title: Coal Operators Refuse to Accept Pact as Model
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21The nation's major coal companies refused today to accept the separate agreement reached yesterday as a model for an industrywide settlement.

title: Bridge:
description: The big winner at the American Bridge Association's AAA tournament at the Roosevelt Hotel here during the weekend was an expert from Washington, Mildred Anderson. She captured the mixedpair the with Julius Fields of New York and the knockout teams with John Jordan and Gerri Flowers of Washington; Robert Seymour of Hillside, N.J., and George Johnson of Charlotte, N.C.

title: Levesque Stresses Economic Troubles In Quebec Address
description: QUEBEC, Feb. 21Premier Ren Lvesque opened a new session of the Assembly today by expressing anxiety over Quebec's economic problems and appealing for collective effort to overcome them.

title: Mrs. Thatcher Touches a Nerve and British Racial Tension Is Suddenly a Political Issue
description: LONDON, Feb. 21The racial tensions that hive been developing in Britain for more than a decade have suddenly been thrust into the center of the nation's political life, and they could conceivably decide who wins the next general elec tion.

title: HOW TO AID THE FUND
description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and sent to P.O. Box 5193, Church Street Station, New York, N.Y. 10249 or to these agencies:

title: Penn State 76. Mass. 69
description: STATE COLLEGE, Pa., Feb. 21 (AP) Penn State beat Massachusetts, 7669, in overtime tonight, assuring its its resigning coach, John Bach, a winning overall record with the Nittany Lions.

title: Suns 114, Braves 111
description: BUFFALO, Feb. 21 (AP)Walter Davis scored 32 points and Paul Westphal had 29 tonight to lead the Phoenix Suns to a 114111 triumphover the Buffalo Braves.

title: SHORTTERM RATES OF INTEREST RISE
description: Shortterm interest rates rose yesterday, and the Federal funds rate moved up, first to 6 percent and later to 6 15/16 percent before the Federal Reserve pumped some temporary reserves into the banking system, presumably to nudge it back down.

title: N.A.S.A.C.P. Position on Deregulation Termed Neutral
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Feb. 21Benjamin Hooks, the executive director of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People, said today that a controversial statement recently issued by the grup's board of directors had been misinterpreted as a call for the deregulation of natural gas.

title: Companies List Earnings Reports
description: For periods ended Dec. 31 unless otherwise indicated. (N) Indicates stock is listed on the New York Stock Exchange, (A) the American Stock Exchange and (O) overthecounter.

title: U.S. Asks Chile to Question Two On 76 Slaying of Allende Aide
description: WASHINGTON, Feb, 21 (AP)United States officials disclosed today that they are seeking to question two Chilean military men about the murder of Orlando Letelier, a former Chilean cabinet officer and diplomat, killed in a bomb explosion on a Washington street in 1976.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Rhode Island 73, Providence 64
description: PROVIDENCE, Feb. 21 (AP)Sly Williams scored 17 points and grabbed 12 rebounds to lead Rhode Island to a 73.63 upset victory over Providence tonight.

title: Egyptian Says Commandos Struck After Unnecessary Cypriot Delay
description: CAIRO, Feb. 21The commander or the Egyptian commando force that became involved in a battle with Cypriot troops when it tried to storm a hijacked plane in Cyprus on Sunday said today that he had begun his assault because the negotiations with the hijackers were being unnecessarily prolonged.

title: Tribute to City Opera Planned in April
description: The New York City Opera Guild has organized a weeklong Operathon 78, April 10 through April 16, to pay tribute to the New York City Opera. The finale of the celebration will be 24 hours of broadcasting over WNCNFM on the last two days. This will include a Celebrity Auction of the Air, in which listeners will be invited to telephone bids for such items aslunch with Beverly Sills. The company's performance of ossini's Il Barbiere di Siviglia on April 16 will be broadcast live from the stage of the New York State Theater.

title: N.H.L. Will Increase Division Rivalries in 79
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 21 (AP)The National Hockey League's board of governors decided today to use an unbalanced schedule emphasizing division rivalries, beginning next season.

title: CRIMINAL LIABILITY  BACKED IN ASSEMBLY
description: TRENTON, Feb. 21A new concept in liability under which judges could require defendants in criminal cases to make restitution for losses was approved in principle today by the Assembly Judiciary Committee. Victims could also file civil Suits for damages.

title: Speaking Out of School
description: In his desire to show that he is going to mastermind the city's school system, Mayor Koch is moving the chess figures around a board he does not own. Instead of. marshaling his forces in Albany to win a difficult battle for a school reform package, he is giving ammunition to the opposition by linking the future of the school system to political and racial gamesmanship.

title: A NotSoFond Farewell to Roosevelt Island
description: I've taken my last ride on the Roosevelt Island aerial tram.

title: Vests Are Tops
description: They are to spring and summer fashions what the shawl was to last fall's styles, though they're much easier to handle.

title: Arkansas 58, Texas Tech 49
description: FAYETTEVILLE, Ark., Feb. 21, (AP) With Marvin Delph hitting 16 points and grabbing seven rebounds, fourthranked Arkansas posted a 5849 victory over Texas Tech tonight and a share of the Southwest Conference championship with Texas.

title: Article 3 -- No Title
TV: Mary Tyler Moore Does a Musical
description: MARY Tyler Moore returns to CBS tonight at 10 o'clock in a musicvariety format, but not without having to confront what is called a longn act to follow. At 8, the networx is presenting Special Olympics, the story of a widowed father coping with three teenage children, the youngest of whom is mentally retarded.

title: American Track: A Foreign affair?
