description: It will come as no surprise if Eamonn Coghlan, Filbert Bayi and Wilson Waigwa finish first, second and third in the mile run during Friday's National Amateur Athletic Union indoor track and field championships at Madison Square Garden.

title: ATTRACTIVE ALTERNATIVE FOUND TO SUPERCARRIER
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (AP)A Navy study has found that a new type of smaller, less costly carrier for conventional warplanes and vertical takeoff jets would be an attractive alternative to building more multibilliondollar supercarriers.

title: Bomb Damages Egyptian's Garage
description: ARLINGTON, Va., Feb. 21 (AP)A burning gasoline can allegedly thrown by a Jewish militant group damaged the garage of an Egyptian World Bank official early today, the second such incident in a week. Saad ElFishawy, 54 years old, an Egyptian who is special adviser to the president of the World Bank, said in a telephone interview that he was unaware of the incident until a reporter phoned him at 4 A.M. The reporter told of receiving a call from the Jewish Committee of Concern, which said it had been responsible for the incident.

title: ETHIOPIA SENDS U.S PROMISE ON SOMALIA
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21The White House said today that the head of Ethiopia's military Government had sent personal assurances to President Carter that Ethiopian forces would neither invade neighboring Somalia nor interfere in the internal affairs of any adjoining countries.

title: The Rich Get Fit At La Costa
description: CARLSBAD, Calif.

title: HIGH COURT CLEARS WAY FOR OIL DRILLING OFF COAST OF JERSEY
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21The Supreme Court today removed the last legal barrier to exploration for oil and natural gas off the New Jersey coast, clearing the way for drilling to begin within a few weeks.

title: Managers Will Buy Western Pacific
description: Western Pacific Industries Inc. announced yesterday that it had agreed to sell its largest asset, the Western Pacific Railrbad, to a new company being formed by the railroad's operating management.

title: New Representative From Bronx
description: Promptly at 7 o'clock on the morning after his election by an unexpectedly large margin over four other candidates to represent the South Bronx in Congress, Robert Garcia stood at the busy subway entrance alongside

title: Connecticut's Urban Tilt  Late and Little
description: Connecticut's gubernatorial race is fully under way now that Gov. Ella Grasso has unveiled her budget for fiscal 1979. The $2 billion spending plan, up 9 percent from last year, promises something to nearly everyonemayors, taxpayers, welfare recipients, businessmen, even farmland preservationists. Yet despite the budget's urban tilt, it offers insufficient relief to Connecticut's hardDressed cities and towns.

title: Article 5 -- No Title
Rodin Sculptures Stolen in St. Louis
description: ST. LOUIS, Feb. 21Three works in bronze by the French sculptor Auguste Rodin were stolen last night from the St. Louis Art Museum. It was the second time in less than a month that the museum had been robbed of works of art.

title: Brezhnev Assails U.S. for Backing IsraelEgypt Talks
description: MOSCOW, Feb, 21Leonid I. Brezhnev condemned United States support of direct IsraeliEgyptian peace talks today and said Moscow still favored a general Middle East conference under SovietAmerican auspices, as the two countries agreed in a statement in October.

title: Pop: New Cobham Band
description: BILLY COBHAM'S drumming was in the forefront of the early jazzrock movement. Through his studio work with Miles Davis and especially nis parucr pation in the Mahavishriu Orchestra, Mr. Cobham went a long way toward defining what jazzrock percussion would sound like. He has always been a remarkable technician, and although he falls a bit too easily into bombast, he also is capable of thoughtful, developmental soloing and careful dynamics.

title: About Real Estate
description: Vacancies have battered the industrial market in the South Bronx over the last 10 years, but the better buildings are making a comeback. Mainly as result of the city's new competitiveness in the area of business relocations, the Bronx buildings have started to capture new buyers, mostly small but growing companies with a history of successful operation.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Feb. 21Former State Senator Alexander J. Menza of Hillside formally entered the race, for the Democratic nomination for United States Senator today with a public request that Governor Byrne stay out of the contest.

title: DISCOVERIES
description: If there's anything harder than mak ing an honest buck, it's saving onehonest or dishonest, First of all, there's that ;gulping maw called taxes, and then there are a lot of junior gulpers like rent and food and a few scraps of material to cover one's modesty. Finally, there are those little plastic cards that give us heaven on the installmrt plan, and nightmares when the biLs come in. So what am I doing tiling yon about another plastic card? A favor, that's what. This one is called the Nothing card, and on first glance it looks just like all those reputable credit cards. There are, however, few differences. The picture on the front is Millard Fillmore, and there no expiration date. The card is good forever. Gibson Carothers, the president of The Nothing Company, says (in jest, of course) that's the one thing. we have over our competitorswe trust our customers. Anyway the card's a hoot and a conversation piece, for $5. Send money and name to The Nothing Company, 1924 Irving Avenue South, Minneapolis, Minn. 55403. If, for some reason, you want telephone, 3744590.

title: Data on Absenteeism By Police Not Ready
description: Mayor Koch's office said yesterday that it still could not provide data to support the Mayor's assertion that police absences had increased since police officers lost 10 days off a year through a change in their duty charts.

title: Reporter's Notebook: Ethiopia Opens Up But Seems to Showas Little as Possible
description: ADDIS ABABA, EthiopiaOutwardly, this city shows few signs of being the eye of a double hurricane, the capital of a country waging both the world's most violent Marxist revolution and its hottest war.

title: Martin, Steinbrenner Open Fire at Lyle
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Feb. 21When George Steinbrenner and Billy Martin were involved in the endless Yankee controversies last year, they were certain to be on opposite sides. This spring, both owner and manager have said they would establish a good relationship, and they apparently tried to prove it today by taking similar stands on Sparky Lyle.

title: Sonic Booms Puzzle Officials
description: CHARLESTON, S. C. Feb. 21 (UPI)Geology officials at the University of South Carolina said today that seven short booms heard in the Charleston area earlier in the day were sonic booms. Geology and military officials said they are uncertain where the sonic booms originated. Air Force officials said there were no aircraft flying that could have created the seven loud noises.

title: Carter Aide Is Helping Abrams Campaign to Win Lefkowitz's Job
description: Borough President Robert Abrams of the Bronx came up with a new device yesterday to publicize his ambition to be State Attorney Generalan endorsement by a White House aide of a candidacy that has not been announced yet and then barnstorming around the state for two days to tell everyone about it.

title: Fastest Antique on Earth
description: Rudolph Valentine's caller took the only seat in sight, a carton of drygoods at the end of a crowded aisle on the second floor of the Penchina Textile Company on Grand Street. Rudy hunkered down alongside his visitor so they could chat face to face. He was all smiling hospitality, cheerfully voluble. Vivacious might be the right adjective. His guest studied the unlined face, almost as lean as the skull itself; the merry eyes; the boyish figure130 pounds or so on a chassis under 5 feet 9 inches. He was thinking that a stranger might guess Rudy's age at 40 or a shade less, and he could imagine what a hoot that would bring from a man who was born on July 12, 1923.

title: 2 Officers Win Case On Issue of Pregnancy
description: The refusal of the New York City Polios Department to rehire two laidoff policewomen because they were pregnant was wrongful discrimination the State Division of Human Rights announced yesterday.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: PARIS, Feb. 21 (AP)PeugeotCitron, Europe's thirdlargest automobile manufacturer, said today it had been discussing possible joint production and distribution agreements in the United States with the American Motors Corporation but is not interested in a merger.

title: St. Francis Defeats Iona In Overtime Game, 7372
description: A reserve guard, Tony Babin, made two free throws with eight sconds left in overtime to give St. Francis a 7372 triumph over Iona last night.

title: Donald G. Sahlin, at 49; Made Muppets for TV For More Than 16 Years
description: Donald G. Sahlin, a puppetbuilder who worked for more than 16 years on the Muppets on television, was found dead Monday morning at his apartment at 360 East 55th Street.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: LONDON, Feb. 21 (Reuters)  The sponsors of the Queen's Club Grand Prix tennis tournament here in June announced today a bonus of 50,000 pounds ($96,750) to the winner, if he goes on to take the Wimbledon title.

title: Advertising
description: The best way to reach consumers in oilrich Bahrain and Kuwait, according to the Middle East Newsletter, is with television.

title: A 21FootLong Portrait of Bureaucracy
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21Question: What has 21 feet and 85 boxes and makes you want to pull your hair out?

title: Notes on People
description: At West Germany's 1978 Bayreuth Festival of Wagnerian opera, the lead role in Te Flying Dutchman will be sung by Simon Estes. The 40yearold American bassbaritone is now appearing with the Zurich Opera. Mr. Estes, an Iowan, has studied and sung in New York and appeared in Seattle's Wagnerian Ring Festival last summer. His selection for the Bayreuth Festival,'announced Monday, would make him the first black . male to sing a title role there. Grace Bumbry, the only other black musician to sing a lead role in the festival, made several appearances in the mid1960's.

title: U.S CUTS ESTIMATE OF QUARTER GROWTH TO 4% FROM 4,2%
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (AP)The Government today cut its estimate of the nation's real economic growth in the fourth quarter to 4 percent from 4.2 percent mainly because of a reduction in inventories.

title: Mrs. Gay Is Ordered to Stand Trial
description: CAMDEN, Feb. 21 (UPI)Roxanne Gay was declared competent today to stand trial in the stabbing death of her husband, Blenda Gay, who played professional football for the Philadelphia Eagles.

title: Senate Report Asserts Torrijos Ignored Drug Dealing by Brother
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21A Senate Intelligence Committee report asserted today that Panama's head of Government, Brig. Gen. Omar Torrijos Herrera, was aware of narcotics dealings by his brother and other Government officials but said charges that General Torrijos himself. had been involved were secondhand and of varying reliability.

title: Tenants in Blighted Areas Restore Buildings and Hopes
description: To a passerby, the drab sixstory tenement 7375 Avenue C on Manhattan's Lower East Side is just one more building struggling to survive against great odds in a slum.

title: Some City Funds Went to Banks for Political Reasons
description: Some New York City funds were deposited in bank accounts that earned no interest solely on the basis of political considerations, according to a grand jury report filed in State Supreme Court.

title: Forest Hills Boy, 14, Is Found Murdered In House Courtyard
description: A 14yearold boy was found stabbed to death early yesterday morning in the courtyard of an apartment building about four blocks from his home in Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Texas 82, S.M.U. 74
description: Austin, Tex., Feb. 21 (AP)  Ron Baxter ignited a secondhalf surge with two 3point plays as 14thranked Texas swept past Southern Methodist, S274, tonight. The victory clinched the Southwest Conference title for the Longhorns.

title: ACTION Drops Plan to Bar Parleys Where Rights Amendment Lags
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (AP)ACTION, the Federal volunteer agency that inchides Vista and the Peace Corps said today that it had abandoned a plan to move its training meetings out of states. rights amendment.

title: Goldin Says City Faces Default Unless U.S. Provides Loan Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21The New York City Comptroller, Harrison J. Goldin told a House banking subcommittee today that the city would be $289 million short of cash in July unless Federal loan assistance was continued and that this shortage would cause the city to default on its obligation.

title: Rettenmund Set Mark
description: SAN DIEGO (UPI)On 16 occasions when he came to hat as a pinchhitter during the 1977 baseball season, Mery Rettenmund of the San Diego Padres drew a base on balls. It was a National league record.

description: ALBANY, Feb. 21The Democratic majority in the Assembly tonight in effect killed a bill that would have eliminated the 4 percent sales tax on home heating fuel.

description: Stock prices sank again yesterday, with a renewed rise in interest rates added to the market's burden of worries, as the Dow Jones industrial average hit another 34month low.

title: Notre Dame 70, N. C. State 59
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Feb. 21 (AP)Dave Batton led the way with 22 points and 12 rebounds tonight as ninthranked Notre Dame beat a cold and foulplegued North Carolina State team, 7059.

title: Desai Government Faces a Test As 5 Indian States Vote Saturday
description: NEW DELHI, Feb. 21The leaders of India's ruling Janata Party are out on the campaign trail again, in a test of their unity and political strength 11 months after they defeated Prime Minister Indira Gandhi.

description: RICHFIELD, Ohio, Feb. 21 (AP)George McGinnis poured in 26 points and Doug Collins 24, leading the Philadelphia 76ers to a 127114 victory over the Cleveland Cavaliers tonight. It was the 76ers sixth in a row.

title: Rumanian Sets Run Mark
description: BUDAPEST Feb. 21 (AP)Natalia Marasescu of Rumania bettered the women's world indoor record for the 1,500meter run today with a time of 4 minutes 5 seconds in the Hungarian track and field championships at Olympic Hall. The previous record of 4:08.1 was established by Mary Stewart of England last year.

title: Market Place
description: Can investors find happiness in a period of rising interest rates and falling stock prices? The answer depends on the investment objectives, the attendant risks assumed and, of course, on a modicum of luck.

title: Energy Expert Asks Study of Facilities For Liquified Gas
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21A Government energy expert recommended today that new studies be made of liquefied natural gas facilities in urban areas to determine what additional safeguards may be needed.

title: Plants Unveiled For Vast Center In Meadowlands
description: SECAUCUS, N.J., Feb. 21A $1 billion development plan was unveiled today for transforming 300 acres of marshland across from the Meadowlands Sports Complex into a major regional commercial and residential are, including a large shopping center, apartment houses, hotels, office buildings and a new commuter bustrain depot.

title: California Is Top Defense Supplier With $10 Billion in U.S. Contracts
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (AP)California led the other 49 states with nearly $10.1 billion in Department of Defense contracts in the last fiscal year, the Pentagon reported today.

title: Best Buys
description: THE FIRST food price decrease in 1978 was reported yesterday by the City Department of Consumer Affairs.

title: Divestitures Are Factor In $71.7 Million Deficit At Searle in 4th Quarter
description: Losses for divestment of unprofitable lines, writedowns and disposals resulted in a $71.7 million fourthquarter deficit for G. D. Searle & Company, according to yesterday's report from Skokie, Ill. headquarters. In the final quarter of 1976 the net income was $7.4 million, or 15 cents a share. For all of last year the leading ethical drug producer lost $28.4 million in contrast to a net income of $61.5 million, or $1.18 a share, cleared in 1976.

title: Vance Says Partial Rejection Of Plane Deal Is Unacceptable
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (Reuters)Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance told Congress today that partial rejection of the Carter Administration's $4.8billion Middle East aircraft sales package would be unacceptable but added that total rejection would also be unaccpetable.

description: PETITION FILED BY:

title: CORRECTIONS
description: Because of a typographical error in the late editions yesterday, the name Cuomo appeared at one point in place of the name Cohn in an article about Roy Cohn. The sentence should have read, A few days after the party, an editorial in The New York Times commenting on the depressed state of political morality, inveighed against those who paid tribute to Mr. Cohn, who at the time was accused of owing back taxes to the city.

title: Letters
description: To THE LIVING SECTION:

title: Firestone Profit for Quarter to Jan. 31 Declined 68.2%
description: Foreignexchange losses, lackluster demand for tires and erratic pricing here and abroad caused a 68.2 percent profit drop at the Firestone Tire and Rubber Company in the first fiscal quarter ended Jan. 31.

title: Foreign Flavor Added to Donations To 66th Annual Neediest Cases Fund
description: A mother who remembered her daughter now living in Israel, a couple from Toledo, Ohio, now in Rio de Janeiro, and four friends from India, now residing in Forest Hills, Queens, were among donors to the 66th annual appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: Survey Finds Most Wills Are Done by Lawyers
description: It stands to reason that members of the American Bar Association want wills, to be drafted by lawyers, and according to a major survey of the public's legal needs released recently in New Orleans during the association's midyear meeting, they don't have too much to worry about.

title: Savin and Ricoh Reach Accord to End Dispute
description: The Savin Business Machines Corporation said an agreement in principle had been reached with the Ricoh Company Ltd. of Japan to settle their longstanding dispute over royalties and other matters.

title: Personal Health
description: VINCENT has bad breath that no mouthwash can erase. June's gums often bleed when she brushes her teeth. Robert s front teeth have begun to spread out and the spaces between them get wider and wider.

title: Woody Allen Is Up For Three Oscars
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 21Woody Allen today became the second person in the history of the. Academy Awards to win nominations for best actor, best alrector, ana USE wriier for one film. With Annie Hallan anguished comedy partly based on the reallife. love affair of Mr. Allen and the actress Diane KeatonMr. Allen duplicated a feat managed only by Orson Welles in 1941 for Citizen Kane.

title: Dissident in South Korea Is Held for Interrogation After Criticizing Regime
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Feb. 21A prominent critic of the Government of President Park Chung Hee was taken into custody by the police for questioning. after he had publicly read a statement accusing the American State Department of defending the President's rule by emergency decree.

title: Police Union to Negotiate Alone On Contract With New York City
description: The Patrolmen's Benevolent Association announced yesterday that it had decided to negotiate alone with the city for a new contract rather than to join a coalition of other city unions in the bargaining.

title: Chess: For the Finest of Finesses There's No One Like Tigran
description: For subtle finesses and positional gambits, it is not easy to surpass the Armenian grandmaster Tigran Petrosian, who held the world championship from 1963 to 1969. His rivals have often teased him for finessing as a matter of course without regard to the real effect on the position, but he wouldn't dream of forgoing his habitual delicate deviousness.

title: House Approves Two Conferences
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (AP)  A bill authorizing President Carter to convene separate White House conferences on the arts and humanities next year was approved by the House today. The 341to65 vote sent the measure to the Senate. The Committee on Education and Labor, which wrote the bill, anticipates that the cost of the White House Conference on the Arts and the White House Conference on the Humanities. will not exceed $3 million for each conference.

title: Witness to 1976 Riot In Village Identifies 5 Who Joined in It
description: A reluctant witness yesterday identified five of nine men accused of taking part in a 1976 riot in Washington Square Park that resulted in the death of one man and serious injury to another.

title: California Oil Tank Burns
description: RIALTO, Calif., Feb. 21 (AP)An oil ank at a Texaco refinery broke into flames today, threatening nearby tanks and sending up a cloud of smoke visible as far away as Los Angeles, 50 miles away. A fire department spokesman said the cause of the blaze was unknown.

title: The Hidden News
description: LOS ANGELESOver the last few days, about 800 people have gathered here in a Congress of the Laity to discuss the religious and social issues of the day. The idea behind the congress was that relieion was too serious to be left to the clergy alone, and that social questions were too important to be left to political leaders. The congress felt the people themselves must get more deeply involved in the spiritual and material conflicts of the nation.

title: Stage: Yale Offers Man Is Man
description: NEW HAVEN MAN IS MAN is one of Brecht's earlier, funnier and more diactic plays. There is a contradiction between being funny and being didactic, and contradiction is the core of Brecht's. art.

title: 7 Dead in Blizzards in England
description: TAUNTON, England, Feb 21 (AP)Blizzards that left snow drifts up to 30 feet deep in parts of southwest England have claimed at least seven lives, the police reported today. More persons may have died trying to dig out of snowedin bomes or escape from trapped cars in the worst winter weather in decades. Rescue operations and helicopter searches have been hampered by blockde roads and fog.

title: New Representative From Bronx
description: Promptly at 7 o'clock on the morning after his election by an unexpectedly large margin over four other candidates to represent the South Bronx in Congress, Robert Garcia stood at the busy subway entrance alongside Man in the News Yankee Stadium, thanking the voters who had brought him victory.

title: World News Briefs
description: MONTREAL, Feb. 21 (AP)The Quebec Court of Appeal ordered a proyincial commission today to stop its investigation of alleged illegal activities by the Royal Canadian Mounted Police, ruling that the commission itself had violated the law.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: Because of a typographical error in the late editions yesterday, the sane Cuomo appeared at one point in place of the name Cohn in an article about Roy Cohn. The sentence should have read, A few days after the party, an editorial in The New York Times commenting on the depressed state of political morality, inveighed against those who paid tribute to Mr. Cohn, who at the time was accused of owing back taxes to the city.

title: Careers
description: Many, graduating from high school and college this June, finding jobs elusive, might consider continuing education courses offered by high schools, YMCA's, community colleges and universities.

title: Beaths
description: ORLEWITZIrene, On Feb 20, 1978. Beloved sister of Felix. Services Thursday 1PM The Riverside 76th St & Amsterdam Ave.

title: Flu Cancels Wrestling Match
description: EDWARDSVILLE, Ill., Feb. 21 (UPI) A wrestling match scheduled tonight between Southern Illinois UniversityEdwardsville and the University, of Missouri  Columbia was canceled because 23 of the 25 Southern Illinois wrestlers have the flu, a spokesman said. The coach of the S.I.U. wrestling team also has the flu, the spokesman said. The match will not be rescheduled.

title: Tenants in Blighted Areas Restore Buildings and Hopes
description: To a passerby, Abe drab sixstory tenement at 7375 Avenue C on Manhattan's Lower East Side is just one more. building struggling to survive against great odds in a slum.

title: The Man Who Danced On Broadway
description: I happened to be walking along Broadway the other day, and as looked around me I tried to imagine what my father had seen in it. He believed in Broadway, just as he believed in boulevards. It was necessary for him to think of the city in which he lived as having a heart. He vasa walker who had to get out Into the street and see that the world was there.

title: Lakers 106, Bulls 104
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 21 (AP)Lou Hudson hit a 30foot jumper with nine seconds to play tonight to enable the Los Angeles Lakers to outlast the Chicago Bulls, 106104.

title: Dollar Recovers a Bit in Europe; Gold Is Down After Big Advances
description: The dollar recouped some of its losses in foreign exchange trading here and abroad yesterday, bouncing back from Monday's alltime lows against the Japanese yen, West German mark and Dutch guilder, the Associated Press reported..

title: The Roots of a Suit: Proof Is in the Label
description: That Pierre Cardin suit you recently bought in this country was made in France, right? Wrong. It was made in New York City, either on West 23d Street (if the suit was part of the designer's boutique line) by Intercontinental Apparel Corporation or on lower Fifth Avenue (if it was one of the designs in his couture collection) by the Grossman Clothing Company. The two companies are the American licensees for Pierre Cardin clothing.

title: Dollar Declines Against Foreign Currency Futures
description: The dollar took another pounding on the foreign currency and precious metals futures markets yesterday. On the Chicago Mercantile Exchange's International Monetary. Market, Swiss franc futures closed up the expanded limit of ninetenths of 1 cent after two successive limit advances of sixtenths of a cent.

title: Shooting Down the B1, Again
description: The B1 bomber keeps coming back from the dead. President Carter killed it last June as too expensive$102 million per planeand less effective than the cruise missile: The Senate agreed twice to rescind funds in the 1977 budget for two more of the giant planes but the House refused to go along. Under a new law mat genies it President the power to impound appropriated funds, the planes will have to be built unless the House reverses itself in another, possibly last chance, today.

title: A Show of Sweets
description: The calorie count at the Louvre skyrocketed recently as the Musts des Arts Decoratifs, which occupies the palace's northwest wing, became a veritable Good Ship Lollipop, filled with hundreds of thousands of bonbons, gumdrops, cookies, jellybeans, licorice, candy canes and other yummies.

title: Medgar Evers, Lehman Gain in City U. Event
description: The Atlantic Coast Conference this is not. But the statement that the City University of New York Tournament represents a new season was never more evident than last night when Medgar Evers, the conference's lastplace finisher, survived two overtimes and upset Baruch College, 7975, in the tourney opener.

title: Obituary 1 -- No Title
description: HENRY LYNE JR.

title: Talks Resume in Anaconda Strike
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (AP)  Representatives, of the Anaconda, Copany's Brass DiviSion and three unions met with Federal mediators today to resume bargaining talks in a 20weekold strike, that has idled 2,400 union members at six brass mills in five states.

title: Charles F. Montgomery, 67, Dies; Professor of Art History at Yale
description: Charles F. Montgomery, a leading authority on American decorative art and a professor of art history at Yale University, died of a heart attack yesterday at the YaleNew Haven Hospital. He was 67 years old.

title: Two Tests for the House
description: The House of Representatives votes today on whether the United States should contribute to an international lending program for countries, seriously pinched by the high price of oil. The House should pass the bill which creates the fundand not encumber it with amendments designed to protect human rights abroad. But it should do so recognizing that the proponents or those amendments have raised some fundamental issues.

title: High Court to Study State Murder Statute
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (UPI)The Supreme Court of the United States agreed today to examine New Jersey's murder statute, which imposes a mandatory life sentence on those convicted by a jury while allowing a maximum of 30 years for those who plead guilty.

title: A School Board in Queens Spurns Job Aid Limited to Poor Children
description: In what some residents are calling a middleclass revolt, a Queens school district has refused to participate in a Federal jobs program because the program would have benefited poor children, most of whom are bused into the community, rather than its middleincome youngsters.

title: Events Today
description: METROPOLITAN OPERA, Lincoln Center, Mussorgsky's Boris Godunov, 8.

title: Homemade: Pretzels, Pudding And Chips
description: IF STRAWBERRY JellO and chocolate pudding, pretzels and potato chips, ketchup and Fig Newtons seem hardly worth the attention of serious gastronomes, it is only because those commonplace, storebought American standbys have acquired bad reputations based on the commercialized version sold in packages.

title: Alliance of Businessmen: New Job Effort
description: WASHINGTON  Shortly. after the urban riots of 1967, President Johnson made an unusual move in the modern history of governmentbusiness relations in this country. He summoned a small group of the nation's top cor

title: Seppi Renggli: A Chef for
description: EAST. HAMPTON, L. I. IF YOU MUST BE trapped in blizzard, there are far less comfortable ways to do it than in your own home, the snow slashing against the panes and a roaring fire in the fireplace. And to have as a bonus the company of one of New York's finest chefs, who had: commited himself to cook a halfdozeniorso of his specialties. For dedicated chef, a promise is a commitment, even if the power fails, the furnace is kaput and the cooking must be done by candlelight and the light of a kerosene lamp.

title: A 21FootLong Portrait of Bureaucracy
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21Question: What has 21 feet and 85 boxes and makes you want to pull your hair out?

title: Huge Center Is Planned in Meadows
description: SECAUCUS, N.J., Feb. 21A $1 billion development plan was unveiled today for transforming 300 acres of marshland across from the Meadowlands Sports Complex into a major regional commercial and residential area, including a large shopping center, apartment houses, hotels, office buildings and a new commuter hus-train depot.

title: Lyons, Only No. 2, Devises; Strategy to Deal With Paris
description: LYONS, FranceFor centuries, the political and economic dominance of Paris over the rest of the country has been a vivid issue in French politics.

title: A Gambler Linked To Mafia Accepts PleaBargain Deal
description: Anthony Salerno, reputedly a major figure in organized crime, pleaded guilty yesterday to Federal tax and gambling charges under a plea bargain that included the dismissal of more serious charges, against him.

title: Deaths
description: HAGENJames of Avon,Ct. age, 66. Born in Long Island, N.Y. Employed by Balton, Barton, Durster and Osborne. Director of Public Relations for US Steel for 25 years. 7 years on the Planning Board of the City of Stamford, for which he was chairman, Banking Commissioner of the state of Connecticut from 1971 to 1975. He was Financial Consultant to Charter Oak Bank & Trust. He's survived by wife Madeline Hagen, daughters Lynn Grow, Janet Widen, Deborah Hagen, a son Peter Hagen. Also survived by three grandchildren. Services to be held 2/22/78, 3PM at Vincent Funeral Home, Canton, Ct.

title: Why Girls Fall in Love With Horses
description: Judith Schultz doesn't mind getting up at 6:30 every morning. She doesn't mind carrying buckets of water to.the barn in her backyard. or feeding her horse, or even cleaning out the stall, then changing her clothes, cleaning herself up and going to school. She doesn't mind missing weekend trips with her friends because she has to take care of the horse. What she worries about is maybe having to give up her horse, whose name is Amy, when she goes to college next year.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: BLADES AWAY There won't be the usual sedate icegliding today at noon across the public skating pond of Rockefeller Center's lower plaza, off Fifth Avenue between 49th and 50th Streets. Midtown watchers should see something considerably livelier, as two 18boy teams from the metropolitan area slam it out in an hourlong hockey match. The players, whose ages range from 9 to 12 years, are members of the Greater New York Ice Hockey League and the Club Hockey League of New Jersey and Long Island. They will play an exhibition game as part of both leagues instructional programs for youngsters.

title: Letters
description: It is surprising that no New York Senator or Representative has recognized that some of the President's tax reform proposals shortchange New York by probably billions of dollars.

title: Mediators Turned to, Miller Opponents in Reaching Separate Pact
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21While the bianmincus coal operators and the United Mine Workers were deadlocked late last week, a union faction and the Federal Mediation Service were executing a series of welltimed end runs that resulted in a tentative contract with a major independent operator.

title: Mideast Shuttle Resumes As Atherton Meets Begin And Dayan in Jerusalem
description: JERUSALEM, Feb. 21 (AP)Assistant Secretary of State Alfred L. Atherton Jr. resumed his Middle East peace mission today in separate meetings with Foreign Minister Moshe Dayan and Prime Minister Menachem Begin.

title: BLUMENTHAL PRESSES ALBANY FOR A PLEDGE ON NE#YORKCITY AID
description: ALBANY, Feb. 21Treasury Secretary W. Michael Blumenthal pressed Governor Carey and the legislative leaders today to commit themselves to state aid to New York City that would grow in the years ahead beyond the $200 million they have already agreed upon for next year.

title: The U. N. Today
News Summary
description: WEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 22, 1978

title: HIGH COURT CLEARS WAY FOR OIL DRILLING OFF COAST OF JERSEY
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21The Supreme Court today removed the last legal barrier to exploration for oil and natural gas. off the New Jersey coast, clearing the way for drilling to begin within a few weeks.

title: Fannie Mae's Board Won't Reappoint 3
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21The Federal National Mortgage Association voted today not to reappoint three members of its board of directors in a move certain to intensify the yearlong feud between the corporation and the Department of Housing and Urban Development.

title: North Carolina's Leaders Worried By Blemishes on the State's Image
description: RALEIGH, N.C.North Carolina, which long prided itself on being the most progressive and enlightened state in the South, now finds itself staggering under the same avalanche of national and international criticism that pinioned the racist regimes of the Deep South states in the 1950's and 60's.

title: McDermott Merger Bid With Babcock Approved
description: NEW ORLEANS, Feb. 21 (AP)Negotiators for J. Ray McDermott & Company Inc., and the Babcock & Wilcox Company announced today that they have approved terms and conditions for a merger.

title: Obituary 5 -- No Title
description: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY BE TELEPHONED TO 3543900 UNTIL 5:30 P.M FOR WEEKDAY EDITION. UNTIL 2:30 P.M. ON SATURDAY FOR SUNDAY EDITION. IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9:00 A.M TO 4:30 P.M MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY; NEW JERSEY (201) MARKET 33900; WESTCHESTER CO. AND NORTHERN NEW YORK STATE COUNTIES (914) WHITE PLAINS 95300; NASSAU CO. (516) 7470500; SUFFOLK CO. (516) 6691800; CONNECTICUT (203) 3487767.

title: Court to Review Ruling on TV Imports From Japan
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21  Over strong objections by the Department, of Justice, the Supreme Court agreed today to review a decision upholding the Government's denial of domestic industry requests to levy additional import taxes on Japanese television sets and other electronic products.

title: A DEFICIENCY BUDGET IS URGED IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, Feb. 21The Assembly and Senate Finance Committees recommended today that, the Legislature adopt a $47.7 million deficiency budget to get the state to the end of this fiscal yearincluding, for the present. Governor Carey's proposal to increase awards only for privatecollege students under the state's Tuition Assistance Program.

title: MRS.  ABZUG CONCEDES HER DEFEAT BY GREEN
description: Conceding her defeat by S. William Green a wek after a special election for an interim term in the House of Representatives, Bella S. Abzug said yesterday that she would not try again this fall for that seat.

title: The Economic Scene
description: Thomas E. Mullaney reports that it appears that President Carter is about to ask the National Alliance of Businessmen to increase its participation in an expanded, Governmentfunded program to deal with the most serious structural unemployment, problems. Page D5.

title: Soccer USA Ready As National Tabloid
description: Having completed what it considers a successful . threemonth test in this market, Soccer Communications Inc. is preparing to go national with its weekly tabloid. Soccer USA.

title: North Carolina's Leaders Worried By Blemishes on the State's Image
description: RALEIGH, N.C.North Carolina, which long prided itself on being the most progressive and enlightened state in the South, now finds itself staggering under the sanie avalanche of national and international criticism that pinioned the racist regimes of the Deep South states in the 1950's and 60's.

title: ABC on Silverman's Quitting
description: FRED SILVERMAN'S parting from ABCTV .last month was not on the warmest of terms. His immediate, superior in the company, Frederick S. Pierce, president of ABC Television, has made no secret of the fact that he was shocked and angered by Mr. Silverman's lack of can?? with him and other higher ABC officials during the week he was planning to accept the position of president and chief executive of the National Broadcasting Company.

title: Construction Is Seen Continuing Rise in '78
description: Construction Is Seen Continuing Rise in '78

title: 140 Vehicles in French Accident
description: PARIS, Feb. 21 (Reuters)More than 140 vehicles, including 40 heavy trucks, were involved in a chain accident on an icebound French highway today, the police said. The accident was on the road lint the the two northern towns of Rouen and Le Havre, To the northeast, another 60 cars piled into each other on the LilleDunkirk road. The police said a total of 12 people had been injured in the crashes

title: Dublin's Prime Minister Denounces Biaggi on Ulster
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21The Prime Minister of Ireland in what an Irish Government official called an unprecedented step. has written to Representative Mario Biaggi, assailing him for supporting groups and individuals closely associated with the cause of violence in Northern Ireland.

title: Rouse Approves Two Conferences
description: WASHINGTON. Feb 21 (AP)A bill authorizing President Carter to convene separate White House conferences on the arts and humanities nest year was approved by the House Tuesday. The 341to 365 vote sent the measure to the Senate.

title: Pop: Night Hawks in Air
description: THE latest group to explore the popular music of the 1920'n and 30's, the New Orleans Night Hawks, has an unusual basis tor authenticity: the collection of more than 4,000 stock arrangements from those decades owned by the group's leader, Vince Giordano, who plays tuba, bass saxophone and string bass.

title: Sadat Breaks Ties With Cyprus
description: CAIRO, Feb. 22Egypt broke diplomatic relations with the Cyprus Government today after a funeral here for 15 Egyptian commandos killed Sunday at Larnaca airport had turned into a demonstration against Palestinians as well as Cypriots.

title: NEW & USEFUL
description: It's been a long, cold, snowy winter, and it's time for a bit of harmless fantasy in our lives: something along the lines of a night light that looks like a mythical fish's head, a pitcher fashioned after a penguin, or a pink box shaped like a seated pig. They're all amusing to look at, but totally practical as well. The handmade ceramic fish head, which is about the size or a human head, emits a faint reddish glow through the mouth and gills. The price tag of $100 is steep, but the fantasy fish needn't be relegated to a child's room. A spotted dog's head wearing a jaunty baseball, cap, though, is definitely meant as a child's night light; few grandparents who could afford it (it's $80) would be able to resist its happy grin. And since it's a good 12 inches across, it's large enough to be a charming wall accessory even when the light is off. The penguin, which sports a, sturdy handle on its back, is 10 inches tall and holds nearly a quart of liquidwhich might as easily be water for the bar as milk for the kitchen; $40. The pig box, seven inches across, could hold anything from sugar to paper clips. It sells for $20. Pizazz, at 811 Lexington Avenue (between 62d and 63d Streets), has the entire ceramic menagerie.

title: Anders Wedberg, 64, in Sweden; Known for Works on Philosophy
description: STOCKHOLM, Feb. 22 (Reuters)One of Sweden's leading philosophers, Prof. Anders Wedberg, has died at the age of 64, his relatives announced today.

title: Kazan Will Direct Lear
description: ELIA KAZAN will return to the theater for the first time in 14 years to direct Richard Burton as King Lear. The play, produced by Alexander. H. Cohen and Hildy Parks, is scheduled to begin rehearsals around Labor Day and open on Broadway during Christmas week, after an outoftown tour.

title: Hideji Kawasaki, Parliament Member In Japan Elected to Seat 11 Times
description: TOKYO, Feb. 22 (AP)Hideji Kawasaki, a senior member of the lower house of Parliament from the governing Liberal Democratic Party, died of an intestinal ailment today, hospital officials said. He was 66 years old and had been elected to Parliament 11 times.

title: U.S. Studies Possible Chilean Role in Exile's Killing
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22Justice Department investigators are pursuing the possibility that high officials in the Chilean Government were involved in planning the assassination of former Chit can Ambassador Orlando Letelier here 17 months ago.

title: MINE ORNERS REJECT BOTTOM LINE OFFER BUT WON'T BAR TALK
description: WASHINGTON, Thursday, Feb. 23The major coal companies, reversing a decision they had announced four hours earlier, said early today that they were willing to resume bargaining with the United Mine Workers union.

title: Indictment Expected on Bribery To Obtain Pictures of Berkowitz
description: At least one person is expected to be indicted today on charges of bribing city employees to obtain photographs of David R. Berkowitz, the suspect in the .44caliber killings, while he was in prison psychiatric ward at Kings County Hospital last fall, lawenforcement officials disclosed last night.

title: Some West Germans Fear. Return of Old MilitaryWays
description: BONNA small group of young West German army officers has started a campaign of criticism of the General Staff and the Defense Ministry, accusing the military leadership of having allowed the armed forces to drift back to conservatism and blind obedience.

title: Brooklyn Man Kills Wife and 3 Children With  a Bat, Police Say
description: A Brooklyn man beat his wife and three children to death last night with a baseball bat, and then tried to kill himself by inhaling gas at the kitchen stove, according to the police.

title: Music: Chamber Group
description: AT some point in the history of any art, its practitioners become intensely conscious that what they are doing is going to be judged by history. The realization ??ones gradually, of course, but there ?? seem to be a moment when self??riticism and awareness of what others ??ave accomplished begin to have a ??aralyzing effect. In composition, Bee??hoven is generally regarded as having ??been one of the great paralyzers, but ??even he produced only a small quantity ??if music, compared to the composers ??who immediately preceded him.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: General News Obituaries/Weather Classified Advertising

title: Gunman Disarmed by Last Hostage After Midwest Robbery and Chases
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ohio, Feb. 22 (AP)An armed bankrobbery suspect's attempt to bargain his way out of a hemmedin car ended tonight when his last hostage disarmed him, the authorities said.

title: ATTACK ON CHINA SEEN IN A HANOI BROADCAST
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 22In a veiled attack that seemed aimed at China, Vietnam charged last night that imperialists and international reactionaries had anned Cambodia and were behind the Cambodians refusal to negotiate their border conflict with Vietnam.

title: Phyllis McGinley, Essayist and Poet Who Won Pulitzer in '61, Dies at 72
description: Phyllis McGinley, the poet and writer whose light verse made bright but trenchant observations on urban and suburban living and won her the Pulitzer Prize for poetry in 1961, died yesterday in New York. She was 72 years old.

title: Leonard Silk
description: Is the fall of the dollar the critical factor in explaining the drop in the United States stock market during the last year despite this country's having achieved the strongest economic recovery and rise in profits among the major industrial countries? Conversely, is the recovery of the stock market in West Germany, despite its slumping economy and falling profits and investment level, a consequence of the climbing value of the German mark relative to the dollar?

title: Acadia Beats Gale to Port,Wins MiamiNassau Race
description: NASSAU, Bahamas, Feb. 22Acadia, a handsome 51foot blue sloop from Louisiana, won the 81boat MiamitoNassau race that ended in Nassau Harbor early today just before a gale began to blow out of the northwest with gusts up to 50 knots.

title: Report on Westway Puts a Better Light on TradeIn
description: A previously unreleased report by the City Planning Commission is considerably more favorable to the idea of trading in Fderal Westway funds for masstransit funds that was disclosed last month in informal remarks by the commission's chairman, Robert F. Wagner Jr.

title: Security at Spofford Center Is Deplored at Hearing
description: New York City's Human Resources Administrator, Blanche Bernstein, said yesterday that the Spofford Juvenile Center was not up to its task of detaining juveniles accused of serious crimes.

title: Home Improvement
description: WHEN FACED with the task of mounting something against a masonry wall or fastening something permanently to a concrete floor or patio, most doityourselfers will think first of using one of the various metal or plastic expansion anchors or plugs sold for the purpose in almost all hardware stores and lumber yards. These require first that a hole of the right size be drilled in the masonry, after which screw or bolt is inserted through the center. When it is tightened, the plug or anchor expands to grip and hold the object securely.

title: STEVENSON TO STALL  A U.S. LOAN TO SEOUL
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22Senator Adlai E. Stevenson 3d, chairman of the Senate Select Committee on Ethics, has advised the South Korean Government that he will block a $500 million American loan unless Seoul makes available information for his committee's investigation into allegations of Korean influence buying.

title: Firefighters Will Bargain Alone
description: Voting against the recommendation or its union leadership, the Uniformed Firefighters Association last night decided not to join a coalition; of other city unions negotiatingfor new ; contract, but to bargain alone with the city.

title: Columbia to Drop Plan to Increase Students in Rooms
description: William J. McGill, president of Columbia University, announced last night that the university would end its consideration of a plan to increase the number of students in rooms in two undergraduate residence halls next September and in the forseeable future.

title: HOW TO AID THE FUND
description: Checks should be made payable to The, New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and sent to P.O. Box 5193, Church Street Station, New York, N.Y. 10249 or to these agencies:

title: Deaths
description: POSTERMelvin. Beloved husband of Harfet. Loving daddy of Michael, Michele and Ronnie. Devoted brother of Herbert Poster. Services Thursday, February 23, 11:45AM. the Riverside 76th St and Amsterdam Ave.

title: Byrne Meets With the President and Says He May Get Review of V. A. Hospital Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (AP)Governor Byrne said today after a fiveminute meeting with President Carter that he might have won a more careful look at a Federal decision to downgrade a proposed $75 million Veterans Administration hospital in Camden.

title: A CambodianThai Battle Accidentally Turns Real
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Feb. 22War in Indochina has always been full of incidents that aren't what they seem to be because the opposing forces, each for its ?? reasons, reach limited accommodations for the sake of local peace and private profit. The tension on the ThaiCambodian border is beginning to produce its share of these incidents.

title: Canada to Increase Spending by 10% in Fiscal Year
description: OTTAWA, Feb. 22Despite restraints imposed on official spending in an effort to deal with inflation and a badly sagging currency, the Canadian Government announced today that budgeted expenditures for the coming fiscal year would increase by nearly 10 percent.

title: Music: Early Americana
description: THE Federal Music Society, founded by Frederick Seich in 1976, to foster awareness of the music that existed in America during the colonial and Federal periods, andnot incidentallyto make use of Mr. Selch's collection of old instruments, came to Town Hall Tuesday night to present a concert honoring the 246th anniversary of the birth of George Washington.

title: NO WRONGFUL DEATH IN LAETRILE VERDICT
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 22A sixmember Federal jury decided today that United States Representative Larry McDonald, an Atlanta urologist, was not responsible for the death of a cancer patient he treated with laetrile.

title: Integrity in Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIAWhen we Philadelphians steal it is for the same reasons other people do: We are hungry (there are many kinds of hunger these days) and cannot otherwise survive, or we are greedy and want to get more than we have faster than honest work may earn it. The same applies to the venality of our politicians, courts and officialswhen they are venal.

title: Dance: Premiere By Rachel Lampert
description: RACHEL LAMPERT is an irrepressible choreographic wit and her company, Rachel Lampert and Dancers, is agile and attractive. Then why was her Tuesday night concert in the Dance Umbrella series at the Entermedia Theater only intermittently successful? Because she sometimes squanders her wit? Perhaps. Because she sometimes lets her company's bounciness compensate for insufficiently developed ideas? Quite possibly.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Move to Oust Kuhn Seen Gaining
description: A backroom movement by a handful of baseball owners intent on dismissing Commissioner Bowie Kuhn reportedly has gained support from onethird of the teams.

title: Calendar of Events
description: Decorating Clinic, W. & J. Sloane, 414 Fifth Avenue (38th Street).

title: Article 5  No Title
Jordan's Power Grows Amid Rising Controversy
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22In the 400 days of his residence here, Hamilton Jordan has been the target of ceaseless gossip, the subject of enough rumors for a racy novel and the butt of dozens of jokes and stories.

title: Blues Tie Penguins, 22
description: PITTSBURGH Feb. 22 (AP)Bernie Federko's eighth goal of the season, with two minutes remaining in the game, pulled the St. Louis Blues, into a 22 tie tonight with the Pittsburgh Penguins in a National Hockey League game. Federko took a pass from Brian Sutter in the slot and fired a 20footer from which the Penguin goalie, Denis Herron, was partially screened.

title: Pilot's Widow to Accept Medal
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (AP)A Navy pilot lost and presumed killed in a bombing raid against North Vietnam nearly 11 years ago has been named to receive the Medal of Honor posthumously, the Navy has announced. Navy Secretary W. Graham Clayton Jr., is scheduled to present the medal to Quay M. Estocin, the widow of Capt. Michael J. Estocin, in a ceremony Monday in the Pentagon's Hall of Heroes.

title: The U.N. Today
Workshop Series on Home Restoration
description: You know that quaint, old house with the front porch down the road that looks just as it did when it was built, 100 years ago? Chances are its early, American charm has been helped along by some 20thcentury labor.

title: Canal Pact Foes in S.endte Lose Procedural Clash With Backers
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22Opponents of the Panama Canal treaties mustered 30 votes todayjust four short of thenumber necessary to defeat the accordsin a losing effort to upset the leadership schedule for Senate consideration of the treaties.

title: Books of The Times
description: IN 33 years, from age 13 until his death at 46, he appeared in 16 plays and 17 movies. He was a twin, and many people asmimed he was Jewish because you're supposed to be Jewish to play so compellingly the part of the sensitive toner, the permanent stranger. He bought and consumed fresh caviar by the pound. He read and recited German poetry in the original. He played the piano, but didn't want anyone to know he could. He had a small penis, and was embarrassed about it, and wet his bed. His friendships were mostly with women and his sex mostly with men. Marilyn Monroe said, He's the only person I know who's in worse shape than I am.

title: U.S. AND BONN AGREE TO CEASE DISPUTING ECONOMICS IN PUBLiC
description: BONN, Feb. 22The United States and West Germany have privately agreed to end their lingering public argument about whether the Germans are pulling their weight in stimulating the world economy, a source close to Chancellor Helmut Schmidt said today.

title: Drysdale 3Set Victor
description: DENVER, Feb. 22 (UPI)Cliff Drysdale faltered in the first set, but came hack to defeat Jan Norliack, 26, 62, 6.3 in the opening round of a $125,000 Grand Prix tennis tournament today. Nick Saviano defeated Heinz Gunthardt, 63, 36, 76.

title: Family Money: The New Debt Collection Act
description: LIKE most other trades, debt collecting has its tricks. Telephone calls late at night or early in the morning. Threats of lawsuits and salary garnishments. The use of fictitious desk names so a delinquent borrower can't tell who's hassling him.

title: F.B.I. Studies Flood and Passman Ties to Contracts
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (AP)The Federal Bureau of Investigation is investigating $16 million in State Department contracts granted to a conference center operated by a man who allegedly paid $69,000 to Representative Daniel J. Flood, Democrat of Pennsylvania, and former Representative Otto E. Passman, Democrat of Louisiana.

title: Two Captors of Most Wanted Fugitive Now Call for His Early Release
description: Henry Barker stepped out of his car in North Miami, Fla., and found six guns pointing at his head. Two and half years after an extraordinary escape while suffering from a hobbling illnessfrom Rikers Island in New York, he was finally tracked down last month and captured. The 29yearold Mr. Barker, who was convicted in 1975 of murderrobbery in Brooklyn, was the first of the most wanted men to be brought back by a new unit in the Correction Department that searches for escapees from New York City's prisons.

title: U.S. Proposes Cut in Greek Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22The Carter Administration is proposing to reduce military aid to Greece by $53 million next year in what some Congressional aides say is an effort to obtain the approval of Congress for lifting the arms embargo against Turkey.

title: Rutgers 81, Villanova 78
description: VILLANOVA, Pa., Feb. 22 (AP)Steve Hefele scored 6 points in overtime tonight to help Rutgers post an 8178 victory over Villanova in an overtime game in which two of the Wildcats top players were sidelined by injuries.

title: Carter Asks Renewal of Job and Training  Programs
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 President Carter asked Congress today to renew for fouryears  the Government's job training and public service employment programs, saying they were becoming increasmgly important in th effort to reduce uinemployment.

title: Ford Uses Link To White House In Sales Venture
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 22 (AP)In break with Presidential tradition, Gerald R. Tord is Using his former White House connection to endorse a commercial prod?? for a fee.

title: Cold Nets Bow, 9483, To Sonics
description: PISCATAWAY, N.J., Feb. 22 (AP)Gus Williams scored 31 points and had 10 steals, leading the Seattle SuperSonics to a 9483 National Basketball Association victory. over the New Jersey Nets tonight.

title: Advertising
description: Hey, gang, next week you're going to begin to hear something nice about yourselves, courtesy of the Emigrant Savings Bank, which is as much a New Yorker as you are, and has hired Ell Wallach, another born New Yorker, to tell you all about it.

title: Three Gunmen Take $150,000 in Diamonds
description: Three gunmen robbed a midtown Manhattan jewelry concern of $150,000 in diamond yesterday, hitting a messenger on the head with a pistol, the police reported. A witness said six persons were in the offices of the Mars Jewelry Company, 125 West 45th Street, when the three entered at about 1 P.M.

title: Hussein Confers With Callaghan
description: LONDON, Feb. 22 (Reuters)King Hussein of Jordan, here on a private visit, met tonight with Prime Minister James Callaghan to discuss developments in the Middle East. Mr. Callaghan gave a dinner for the King at the Prime Minister's official residence. The British leader plans to visit Jordan next weekend.

title: M'DERMOTT PLEADS GUILTY TO FRAUD, FINED $1 MILLION
description: NEW ORLEANS; Feb. 22 (AP)J, Ray McDermott & Company, the world's largest builder of offshore oil rigs, pleaded guilty today to fraud, racketeering and other charges and was fined $1 million.

title: Around the Nation
description: CHICAGO,. Feb: 22A threejudge panel of the United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit has ordered the Chicago Fire Department to favor members of minorities when making permanent promotions from three of its eligibility lists.

title: Hawley Stores End Bid to Buy  Marshall Field
description: Three, weeks after it made a formal tender offer to acquire Marshall Field & Company, Carter Hawley Hale Stores Inc., yesterday abruptly. withdrew its $380 million bid.

title: 2 ARE FOUND GUILTY IN LEVYISBORO DEATHS
description: WHITE PLAINS, Feb. 22A Westchester County jury today found Willie Profit, 25 years old, and Samuel Ayala, 26, both of Norwalk, Conn., guilty of all 28 charges against each of them in the slayings last March of two Lewisboro, N.Y., women.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Plans for two potential gamblingcasino hotel properties in Atlantic City were jolted with the disclosure that neither the Department of Environmental Protection nor the United States Army Corps of Engineers will allow the city to move Bader Field Airport to new site in the wetlands.

title: CORRECTION
description: In early editions of The Living Sec tion yesterday, the chef of the Fou Seasons restaurant was identified in correctly. His name is Joseph (Seppi Renggli.

title: Jordan's Power Grows Amid Rising Controversy
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22In the 400 days of his residence here, Hamilton Jordan has been the target of ceaseless gossip, the subject of enough rumors for a racy novel and the butt of dozens of jokes and stories.

title: Park to Return Promptly
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (UPI)The State Department disclosed today a United StatesKorean understanding that Mr. Park would not be arrested while in the United States and would be allowed to return to South Korea promptly after his testimony.

title: Wrong Message From Board 26
description: New York's Community School Board 26, in Queens, wanted to send a message to Washington: Federal aid programs designated for specific purposes are not helpful because they do not allow for local discretion in the use of the funds. Specifically, job programs should not be limited to poor youths.

title: TORRIJOS BROTHER DNIES DRUG CHARGE
description: MADRID, Feb. 22 (AP)Panama's Ambassador to Spain, Moises Torrijos Herrera, denied today that he had smuggled narcotics into the United states, and asserted that an indictment naming him was part of a piot to block Senate ratification of the Panama Canal treaties.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: WITH IT More than 100 preparatory drawings, illustrated books, journals, posters, prints and material on printing processes are included in new exhibition, Printing in France, 18501900: the Artist and New Techniques, running through April 8 at the scholarly Groilier Club, 47 East 60th Street. The admissionfree display shows how avantgarde artists such as the Barbizon group led by Corot, and later. Vuillard, Bonnard, ToulouseLatrec, Daumier and others, creatively adapted to and exploited new techniques.

title: Deliberate Loss of Face By Dyson Is Not Funny To G.O.P. Lawmakers
description: ALBANY, Feb. 22State Commerce Commissioner John S. Dysonunder attack for using a picture of himself in statepaid advertisements to attract business to New Yorkappeared at a legislative hearing today wearing a black mask and provoked a walnut of furious Republican Senators. They said later they would block Mr. Dyson's appointment to a second post as chairman of the Urban Development Corporation.

title: MentalHealth Volunteers Pressing Bid for U.S. Aid
description: MONTOLAIR, Feb. 22Fifty volunteers from the New Jersey Association of Mental Health will meet with state Congressional leaders to press for continued Federal support of community mentalhealth centers.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: CHALLENGING ROUTE: Bicyclists in Central Park found the frozen pond an adventurepome tour. Today, temperatures are expected to be slightly warmer than yesterday's 17 to 27 degrees, with high of 35 expected.
