description: Alexander, Fay

title: Zionist Congress Draws Up Plan For 31 Settlements in Arab Areas
description: JERUSALEM, Feb. 22As the Israeli Government reappraises its policy on settlements this week, a proposal for the creation of 31 new ones in occupied Arab territories over the next four years was presented today to a congress of the World Zionist Organization here.

title: Books: Mr. Birdwatcher Sits for His Portrait
description: BIRD WATCHERSof whom, the authors say, there may be as many as 40 million in this country, counting the ones who gaze at their backyard feederscome in all colors and species, like birds. Chances are that most of them who THE WORLD OF ROGER TORY PETERSON. An Authorized Biography. By John C. Devlin and Grace Naismith. Foreword by Elliot Richardson. Illustrated. 266 pp. Times Books. $14.95. go about it halfway seriously started off with Roger Tory Peterson's A Field Guide to the Birds.

title: Limited Marijuana Use Approved
description: SANTA FE, N.M., Feb. 22 (AP)Gov. Jerry Apodaca signed into law yesterday a bill to legalize the use of marijuana for medical purposes under very limited circumstances. The measure is based on evidence that marijuana helps relieve advese side effects of cancer chemotherapy and the painful effects of glaucoma. The first beneficiary of the law will be Lynn Pierson, a 26yearold student who said he has been using marijuana since 1976 to ease the effects of chemotherapy for treatment of lung cancer.

title: Two Captors of Most Wanted Fugitive. Now Call for His Early Release
description: Henry Barker, stepped out of his car in North Miami, Fla., and found six guns pointing at his head. Two and half years after an extraordinary escape while suffering from a hobbling illnessfrom Rikers Island in New York, he was finally tracked down last month and captured. The 29yearold Mr Barker, who was convicted in 1975 of murderrobbery in Brooklyn was the first of the most wanted men to be brought back by a new unit in the Correction Department that searches for escapees from New York City's prisons.

title: Deaths
description: ALEXANDERFay (Ehrenworth) of Kings Point Seville, Delray Beach, FL. Beloved wife of the late Sylvan. Devoted mother of Joan Willner. Devoted motherinlaw of Harry WiIIner. Loving sister of Rose Schwartz, Bee Katz, Norma Michaelson, Evelyn Temple. Adored grandmother of 2 grandchildren, Steven & Paul. Services were held at I.J. Morris Funeral Home, Flatbush & Kings Highway. Brooklyn, NY, Tuesday, February 21, 1978.

title: Events Today
description: RIDDLES OF THE SPHINX, a film by Loura Mulvey and Peter Wollen, at the Film Forum.

title: Dr. Pierce, Expert on Electricity In Atmosphere, Kills Himself
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 22 (UPI)Dr. Edward T. Pierce, a physicist and an authority on atmospheric electricity, jumped to his death from an eighthfloor hotel room today, police reports said. He was 61 years old.

title: Dutch to Reconsider Aid to Cuba
description: THE HAGUE, Feb. 22 (AP)The Dutch Government said today that it would review its program of development aid to Cuba in light of Cuba's military activity in Africa. Dutch aid to Cuba has totaled $26 million since 1975.

title: Jackson Says China Wants U.S. Oil Skill
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (AP)Chinese leaders want to work out an agreement that would let them purchase petroleum technology from United States energy companies, Senator Henry M. Jackson said today.

title: News Summary
description: A harsh antiterrorism policy has been put into effect in Rhodesia. The Government has warned blacks living in a tribal area on the eastern border that adult curfew violators will be shot and that their children will be shot if they leave their villages, even in daylight. The warning was given in a pamphlet read in Parliament by a black member. He warned that such measures are seriously undermining support for the Government initiative for an accord for eventual transfer of power to the black majority. [Page A1, Column 1.]

title: Berlin Opera Ballet Will Visit
description: The Berlin Opera Ballet, with Valery and Galina Panov as guest artists, will make its American debut at the New York State Theater in an engagement running from next July 3 through July 15.

title: TRW Sharply Raises Takeover Bid for ESL
description: TRW Inc., the conglomerate, sharply raised its takeover bid for ESL Inc., an electronic datasystems company, both concerns said yesterday.

title: A Choice of Drugs
description: A New York State law that requires pharmacists to fill many prescriptions with relatively inexpensive drugs continues to meet, intense opposition from the drug industry and local pharmacists. The industry contends that consumers risk getting drugs that are neither safe nor effective. The pharmacists want to, keep the law from going into effect on April 1at least until malpractice liability questions are resolved. These issues were considered during a protracted legislative battle. They should not be allowed to weaken or postpone a longoverdue effort to bring consumers some relief from drug costs.

title: State Makes Spot Checks to Catch Oil Trucks That Cheat Customers
description: NEWARK, Feb. 22  The workday started out like all others this winter for Candy Campbell, who drives a fueloil delivery truck here for his father's combany, Advance Heating.

title: Senior Tennis Scheduled
description: The New York State senior indoor tennis championships for men 55, 60 and 65 will start March 13 at the Parade Grounds Tennis Center in Brooklyn. Entries go to Len Hartman at the center, 305 Coney Island. Avenue.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: LAHTI, Finland, Feb. 22 (AP)Finland, sparked by Hikka Riihivouri's strong thirdleg effort, won the women's 20kilometer (12.4mile) crosscountry relay today at the world nordic ski championships.

title: THE MOON SEMINARY DENIED CREDENTIALS
description: ALBANY, Feb, 22After more than two years of study and debate, the New York State Board of Regents today denied an application from the Rev. Sun Myung Moon's Unification Theological Seminary to become a degreegranting institution chartered by the state.

title: Smithsonian Responds to Its Critics
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22  The Smithsonian Institution today released a detailed reply, to an equally detailed and critical Congressional study that focused on the institution's money management, specifically that of S. Dillon Ripley, its director.

title: World News Briefs
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Feb. 22 (AP)The people of this divided province today buried five persons killed in a firebomb attack on a crowded restaurant that has inflamed sectarian feelings.

title: Manhattan Defeats Fordham by 10392
description: Manhattan College's Steve Grant stole the spotlight last night with a careerhigh 37 points in leading the Jaspers to a 10392 victory over Fordham at Madison Square Garden.

title: Hers
description: MY FRIEND and I, two women obviously engrossed in conversation, are sitting at a corner table in the crowded Oak Room of the Plaza at 10 o'clock on Tuesday night. A man materializes and interrupts US with the snappy opening line, A good woman is hard to find.

title: Catholic 66, F.D.U. 60
description: RUTHERFORD, N.J., Feb., 22Joe Colletta, a freshman guard, scored 21 points tonight to lead CatholicUniversity to a 6660 victory over Fairleigh Dickinson.

title: Design Notebook Feeling at Home In St. Peter's
description: ATTENDING services, jazz concerts or lectures at the new St. Peter's Lutheran Church, Lexington Avenue at 54th Street, makes some people reel right at home.

title: Letter: On the U.S. Cabinet
description: To the Editor:

title: Joan Little OrderedExtradited by Carey
description: ALBANY, Feb. 22Citing his constitutional obligation, Governor Carey ordered today that. Joan Little be returned to North Carolina, where she fled last October from a prison that she said had singled her out for abuse.

title: Dollar Is Mixed in Trading Abroad
description: The dollar turned in a mixed performance in foreignexchange trading abroad and in New York yesterday, as central banks of several countries moved in to cushion it after steep declines earlier in the week, The Associated Press reported.

title: Deaths
description: HYMANNathanBeloved husband of Rose. beloved father of Adele, Nat and Ben, beloved grandfather of Arlene, Howard, Doris, Lenard, Jayne and Nanette. Services were held Wednesday, Feb 22.

title: Kings 127, Lakers 122
description: KANSAS CITY, Feb. 22 (AP)Scott Wedman scored 5 of his 19 points in overtime tonight and led the Kansas City Kings to a 127122 victory over the Los Angeles Lakers. Wedman scored a 3point play with 3:56 left in overtime to put Kansas City ahead for good, 121118.

title: Article 3  No Title
3 Children Die in Chicago Fire
description: CHICAGO, Feb 22 (Reuters)Three children were killed today and at least seven other people were injured when fire destroyed a twostory frame house on Chicago's South Side, the police said. Dead were brothers John end Thomas Watson, 5 and 3 years old, respectively, And their sister Yvonne, 4. Injured were their parents, Mr. and Mrs. Charles Watson; three members of another family living on the upper floor of the home, and two firefighters.

title: Spanish Fighter Dies of Injuries
description: MADRID, Feb. 22 (UPI)  Juan Rubio Meiero, Spanish middleweight boxer, died, today of brain injuries suffered in a fight last Friday, a spokesman for the Francisco Franco hospital said.

title: Deaths
description: CUMMINGSFrancis L. On February 21, 1978. Beloved wife of Edwin L. Cummings of Pelham Manor, devoted sister of Joseph R. Lillagore of North Carolina. Reposing Geo. T. Davis Inc, 14 Lecount PI, New Rochelle, where friends may visit Thursday 24 and 79PM. Funeral Mass Friday, 10AM, Our Lady of Perpetual Help Church, Pelham Manor. Interment Sleepy Hollow Cemetery.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: A tentative agreement for CBS Inc to purchase a market research company known as IMS International for $79 million in cash fell through yesterday.

title: There's a Hot Line. For Ailing Plants
description: The number of calls on the New York Horticultural Society's plant line has been so voluminous, a new telephone number has been installed: 7570917. The line will open from 2 to 4 P.M.;. Monday through Friday, to receive calls on all kinds of plantgrowing problems, from starting seeds to curing ills.

title: Night Work Opposed in Japan
description: TOKYO, Feb. 22 (AP)A women's rights group has urged restrictions on night work by men in Japan. A report submitted this week to the Government by 28 women's organizations says that working at night damages the health of both sexes.

title: 4 States Charge U. S. Fails to Safeguard Against Dangers of Liquefied Gas
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22State officials from New York, New Jersey, Massachu setts and California testified today that the Federal Government had failed to protect the public against the potential hazards of liquefied natural gas.

title: Queens Board, to Bar Ethnic Census, May Spurn Aid
description: A Queens school district is apparently prepared to pass up $1.1 million in Federal funds because applying for the funds might undercut a suit it has filed to avoid divulging ethnic data on its school staffs.

title: Queens Board, to Bar Ethnic Census, May Spurn Aid.
description: A Queens school district is apparently prepared to pass up $1.1 million in Federal funds because applying for the funds might undercut a suit it has filed to avoid divulging ethnic data on its school staffs.

title: Townsend Plan, Once the Hope Of Thousands, Is Near Death
description: CASPER, Wyo., Feb. 22 (AP)The National Townsend Plan, a stepchild of the Depression, was a country doctor's vision that fired the imagination of thousands and fostered the Social Security Act. Now it is dying.

title: CHARGES IN THE BRONX SPUR H.E.W. INQUIRY
description: Joseph A. Califano Jr., the Secretary of Health, Education: and Welfare, has ordered an investigation of charges that, for religious and racial reasons, his department turned down a Bronx school district's request for a $44,000 grant.

title: Crusader for Atheism Presses Drive From Center in Texas
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Feb. 20Some pilgrims visit. Mecca or the Wailing Wall or the Vatican, but one family sought out a different shrine today, the American Atheist Center, and its founding mother, Madelyn Murray O'Hair.

title: Take the Cadillac
description: The Mayor of New York wants some mail.

title: Q&A
description: Q. We have plasticdomed skylights set into the roof of our ranch house.. Where the plastic ,meets the roof, there are 3inch wide metal strips on top of the wood. The lower edge of this metal forms condensation on the inside so that water drips down the sides of the interior redwood frame and stains the wood. Can you tell us how to, eliminate the dripping problem? I.R., Wayne, N.J.

title: Bridge:
description: After three rounds of the Von Zedtwitz double knockout team championship, an event in which almost all the top New York stars compete during a ninemonth period, the defending champion team headed by Edgar Kaplan is one of eight groups still unbeaten.

title: Panel to Resume Inquiry on Miller As Reserve Chief
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22The Senate Banking Committee decided today to continue its investigation of G. William Miller, President Carter's choice to replace Arthur F. Burns as chairman of the Federal Reserve board.

title: Panel to Resume Inquiry on Miller As Reserve Chief
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22The Senate Banking Committee decided today to continue its investigation of G. William Miller, President Carter's choice to replace Arthur F. Burns as chairman of the Federal Reserve board.

title: REPUTED MOBSTER UPHELD ON SILENCE
description: TRENTON, Feb. 22The New Jersey Supreme Court today upheld the right of a reputed mobster, Carl (Pappy) Ippolito of Morrisville, Pa., to refuse to tell the state's Investigation Commission whether he knew suspected organizedcrime figures unless he was granted immunity.

title: A Cask of Amaretto
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22  When a woman, who refuses to be identified, claims a White House aide spewed a drink down her back at a swinging barthat's not news.

title: Deliberate Loss of Face By Dyson Is Not Funny To G.O.P. Lawmakers
description: ALBANY, Feb. 22State Commerce Commissioner John S. Dysonunder attack for using a picture of himself in statepaid advertisements to attract business to New Yorkappeared at a legislative hearing today wearing a black mask and provoked a walkout of furious Republican Senators. They said later they would block Mr. Dyson's appointment to a second post as chairman of the Urban Development Corporation.

title: Italians Arrive on 57th Street
description: SIXTY ITALIAN furniture designers and manufacturers and homefurnishings journalists flew into New York this week for.the opening of Abitaire, the new retail furniture store 212 East 57th Street specializing, at least for the time being, in Italian imports. The visitors were all wearing little orange buttons that said, Sono Italiano Ma Adoro New York (I am Italian but I love New York). The buttons, said the Milanese designer, Eleonore. Peduzzi Riva, were supplied by the shop, but we totally agree with what they say.

title: Hawks Beat Rangers, 32
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 22The Rangers Tell victim to a. Bulley tonight at Chicago Stadium. Ahead of the Black Hawks, 20, as the third period started. New York let three Chicago goals whiz into the cage, two by Ted Bulley, giving the Hawks a 32 victory.

title: SOVIETSYRIAN TALKS END; FOCUS ON ARMS INDICATED
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 22 (Reuters)Syrian and Soviet leaders today ended two days of talks that apparently concentrated on ways the Kremlin could help Arab opponents of Egypt's peace initiative with Israel.

title: A Harpsichord Recital
description: HANDEL'S keyboard suites aren't nearly as deep as Bach's. But when they are played with as much enthusiasm, intelligence and imagination as the harpsichordist William Tim Read summoned Tuesday night at Carnegie Recital Hall, the robust spontaneity of the music is irresistible.

title: Party Hails Publication Of Jones's Last Novel
description: IN a military setting reminiscent of his war novels, the late James Jones was remembered last night by 270 famous friends and fans who gathered at an East Side armory to celebrate the posthumous publication of his novel Whistle.

title: Mime: Bob Berky Presents Show
description: THE characteristic excitement of mime lies in those moments when an essence is caught. in the peculiarly immediate way that poetry can cut through to the kernel of an idea or substance. Both depends on the refinement of technique. When the essence goes unrevealed, as it did in a program by Bob Berky at the Theater of the Open Eye on Tuesday, mime seems to fail more totally than dance or theater forms that have greater literal or technical content to shore them up.

title: Shavers, Holmes Matched in Elimination Bout
description: A week after the dethroning of Muhammad Ali, boxing returned to normal yesterday with an announcement that Earnie Shavers would fight Larry Holmes and a threat that if Leon Spinks did not .defend the title against Ken Norton, the world would have two heavyweight champions.

title: POLAROID PROFITS. UP 18% IN QUARTER
description: Profits of the Polaroid Corporation in the final quarter last year rose 18 percent and for all of 1977, by 16 percent., William J. McCune Jr., president of the photographic equipment maker, said yesterday.

title: ORDERS TO FACTORIES FOR DURABLE GOODS OFF 4.4% IN JANUARY
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (AP)Orders received by factories for durable goods declined 4.4 percent in January, mainly due to reduced orders for defense aircraft and parts, the Commerce Dpaertment said today.

title: Letters
description: To THE HOME SECTION:

title: Supreme Court Roundup Burger Says Colleagues Sidestep Vital Rights Issue
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22Chief Justice Warren E. Burger charged today that his Colleagues on the Supreme Court had sidestepped an important civil rights issue directly before them and, in effect, thus greatly broadened Federal jurisdiction in the area.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Mayor Koch's office yesterday provided statistics to support the Mayor's contention the other day that policemen had been taking more days off since their duty charts were changed, requiring them to work more.

title: Companies Report Earnings
description: For periods ended Dec. 31 unless otherwise indicated. (N) indicates stock is lisled on the New York Stock Exchange. (A) the American Slock Exchange and (O) overthe counter.

title: Disks: Marriner Leads Haydn Symphonies
description: HAYDN'S 100plus symphonies remain in unexplored resource as far as most conductors are concerned. We have a complete set of the symphonies on record. to be sure, in Antal Dorati's laudable traversal plus a rather more difficult to obtain set from Ernst Marzendorfer. But laudable and lovable are different adjectives. Mr. Dorati's conducting has its virtues: it's solid and conscientious, and the budget price is attractive. But at its worst it's leaden and unimaginative, and the field is. certainly open for performances with greater imagination, crisper execution and richer sound.

title: Couple Send 50th Gift to Neediest
description: Gifts totaling $200 from guests at a Christmas party given by Alan R. Thompson of Brooklyn have been received by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: Looking at Reality
description: BOSTON, Feb. 22In the folklore of journalism, scoops are overrated. It is entertaining to steal a beat on a story that is about to break anyway, but the knockabout spirit of The Frontpage cannot justify the great freedom of the American press. What does is the uncovering of concealed official business orless romantic but just as importantthe exploration of open but unrecognized social or political conditions. We all have partial vision, and it is one function of the press to make us see.

title: PARKWAY POLICE SEIZING SOLICITING HOMOSEXUALS
description: In an effort to deter homosexual solicitation in Garden State Parkway restrooms, the New Jersey State Police yesterday asked news organizations to begin publishing the names of those arrested for the crime.

title: Joseph Durso
description: Jack Dempsey sat in front of a television set in his apartment on the East Side of Manhattan a week ago and watched 24yearold Leon Spinks take the heavyweight title from 36yearold Muhammad Ali. His wife, Deanna, sat with him. And when it was over, the 82yearold former champion shook his head and said:

title: Owner of Candy Store in Queens Is Grieving Over Stabbing Victim
description: In Rego Park, Queens, Winther's Confectionery is a gatheringplace for youngsters, and about 30, out of school for the winter recess, were having a good time yesterday. But Anthony Maggio, owner of the luncheonette and icecream parlor, was grieving.

title: Auditorium Is Named for Walter
description: At dedication ceremonies last night the auditorium in the New Yrk Public Library at Lincoln Center was named the Bruno Waler Auditorium in honor of the internationally known conductor. The library and the Milliard School recently received a girt of $450,000 from the Bruno Walter Memorial Foundation.

title: YIELD ON U.S. ISSUES HITS A 2YEAR HIGH
description: Yields on Treasury and Federal agency securities climbed yesterday to their highest levels in two and a half years.

title: Cypriot President Says Cairo's Raiders Could Have Caused a Massacre
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Feb. 22President Spyros Kyprianou charged in an interview today that the Egyptian commando attack on the Cyprus Airways plane Sunday, in which two terrorists held a dozen hostages, could haw produced a massacre.

title: House Panel Skeptical on Plan for South Korea
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22Secretary of Defense Harold Brown ran into Congressional criticism and skepticism today when he testified for the first time on behalf of the Administration's request to transfer $800 million in military equipment to South Korea as part of a phased withdrawal of United States Army gtound forces from that country.

title: Market Place
description: Savin Business Machines, under cloud as a result Of an extended dispute with the Ricoh Company, the Japanese manufacturer of its copier machines, settled those differences on Tuesday and burst into the Wall Street sunlight.

title: Exposure of Corruption Raises Questions About Reporters Masquerading.
description: A reporter wanting to write an article about the problems of bluecollar workers gets a job on an assembly line for a few weeks but does not let anyone know he is a reporter.

title: About New York
description: The problem with writing poetry wholeheartedly is figuring out how to survive while you do it. But after that it's O.K., according to Robert Hershon, a Brooklyn man who edits poetry, teaches it, recites it and prints it for modest living in order to keep on composing it.

title: BauschRevlon Talks Halt
description: Bausch & Lomb said late yesterday hat it and Revlon were no longer discussing a possible combination of the two companies. When these discussions first were disclosed on Jan. 18;, Bausch & Lomb's stock rose 43/4 points to 477/8. Yesterday, shares of the optical goods producer were unchanged at 50.

title: U.S. TAKES BRIGHTERVIEW OF RHODESIA NEGOTIATIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22, (Reuters)  The United States shifted toward a more positive stand on Rhodesia internal settlement talks today, referring to recent moves there as significant.

title: MINE OWNERS REJECT MARSHALL INVITATION TO RENEW BARGAINING
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22Secretary of Labor Ray Marshall announced 4onight that the major coal companies had refused his invitation to renew fadetoface bargaining with the United Mine Workers union. In doing so, he said, they rejected a bottom line offer from the union.

title: S.E.C. Blueprint: 2d Look
description: A second look at the Securities and exchange Commission's blueprint for a national market system in securities trading suggests that Wall Street's Washington regulators may have embarked on a divideandconquer camEconomic Analysis paign. At first, the innustry's reaction to the comprehensive, 58page document was surprisingly favorable, with praise for its evolutionary tack. But in less obvious ways, numerous parts are likely to set the breadandbutter interests of one Wall Street fraternity against those of anotherand thereby diminish the likelihood of a united industry front against the S.E.C.'s farreaching requirements.

title: City College, Hunter Gain Semifinals
description: The 13th annual City University of New York tournament attracted 3,000 fans last night to City College's Nat Holman gym and they watched the two top seeded, teams, City College and Hunter, breeze into tomorrow night's semifinals.

title: New SexOriented TV Shows Planned
description: SCIENCEFICTION and World War II television programs failed to catch on this season, and attempts to revive the western, the medical melodrama and the courtroom drama were all generally unsuccessful.

title: Big Board and Amex Issue Reports Of Changes in Stock by Insiders
description: The New York and the American stock exchanges issued yesterday their latest reports of changes in stock of officers, directors and large stockholders in companies whose shares are listed on the exchanges.

title: Deaths
description: KUPFERMANSidney, The Rego Park Jewish Center and affiliates note with profound sorrow the passing of It's loyal and devoted member of many years. To his wife Edith and the family, we extend our heartfelt condolences. Funeral services Friday, Schwartz Brothers, 1:30PM.

title: First Cadillac Agency Closing Due to Costs
description: BOSTON, Feb. 22 (AP)The Cadillac Automobile Company, founded 50 years ago as the nation's first Cadillac agency, will close its doors March 1 because of high costs, said Peter Fuller, owner and president. Mr. Fuller said he will sell the fivestory building, which has marble columns imported from Italy, an ornate chandelier, oriental rugs and elaborate paintings on the walls. It is valued at about $3 million.

title: Congress Chides Commodity Board
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (UPI)Two Congressional investigative reports today ihharged that the Commodity Futures Trading Commission has been lax in combating some abusive trade practices and used questionable practices in furnishing its headquarters.

title: Hasty Pudding Club Lets a Bastion Fall
description: CAMBRIDGE, MASS.

title: Covering Furniture: Stay Loose
description: Nowadays you can throw a big patchwork quilt over a chair, tuck it in, tie a cord around the bottom and call it slipcovered. Perhaps it's not quite that easy, but if you're handy, you can duplicate the new softness that designers and decorators currently favorfurniture covered with fabrics that flow instead of fitting tightly. Even lamps arid tables have taken on the look with, molded and sculpted trompe l'oeil fabric? forms, or lace or silk scarves thrown over them.

title: Philippines Called Crucial to the U.S. Despite Rights Issue
description: HONOLULU, Feb: 19  Despite the Carter Administration's criticism of alleged human rights violations in the Philippines; civilian and military officials in the Pacific and in the Pentagon want to strengthen military ties with President Ferdinand E. Marcos because, they assert, his country is crucial to United States interests in Asia.

title: Martha Eliot
description: Dr. Martha May Eliot, an unmarried woman who devoted her life to problems of maternity and child care, died last week in Cambridge, Mass., where she had been living. She was 86 years old.

title: Recital: Jan Peerce, 2 Colleagues
description: NOT all old tenors just fade away. Some of them keep on singing. Jan Peerce, who is 73 years old; turns up more or less regularly at Carnegie Hall, and he was there again Tuesday night, sharing a program with two younger colleagues, Laura Thomas, soprano, and Pablo Elvira, baritone.

title: Court Rejects Request To Bar Leg Amputation
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (UPI)The Supreme Court today turned down the request of a 72yearold Tennessee woman that it stop doctors from amputating both her feet, which is gangrenous from frostbite. Surgeons say the operation is needed to save the me of Mary Northern, but she does not believe them and does not want the operation.

title: Harlem Dance Theater, Columbia in Joint Venture
description: Columbia University and the Dance Theater of Harlem yesterday announced the start of a producing and educational collaboration between the ballet company and the university's School of the Arts.

title: Short Interest on Big Board Fell to 32.3 Million Shares in Month
description: The New York Stock Exchange reported yesterday that short interest fell 706,266 shares in the month ended Feb. 15 to 32.3 million shares. The short interest for the yearearlier level totaled 26.3 million shares.

title: Dividends
description: WEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 22, 1978

title: Rep. Burton Held Likely to Seek House Leader's Post
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Feb 22Red entative Phillip Burton, Democrat of california, apparently intends to challenge epresentative Jim Wright of Texas for he majority leadership of the House after the elections this fall.

title: Supplies, for Ethiopia Withheld by U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (AP)  The United States: has decided to tighten its arms embargo against Ethiopia by blocking shipment of two patrol boats and oilier military equipment cleared for delivery last June.

title: RHODESIA THREATENS WARZONE VILLAGERS
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Feb. 22In one of the harshest applications of its war policy yet disclosed, the Government of Rhodesia has warned blacks living in a tribal area on the country's eastern border that adult curfew violators will be shot and that their children will be shot if they venture out of their villages, even in daylight.

title: Firmani In Control Of Cosmos
description: MIAMI, Feb. 22Eddie Firmani's decision yesterday to exclude Shep Messing from the plans of the Cosmos was viewed today as a strong indication that the coach was in total control of the onfield aspects of the North American Soccer League team.

title: Ford to Aid South African Blacks
description: JOHANNESBURG, Feb 22 (AP)The Ford Motor Company will give $570,000 to a whiteled business group that hopes to improve the living conditions of South Africa's nine million urban blacks, the company has announced. The gift follows a visit last month by Henry Ford 2d to the company's plant in the coastal city of Port Elizabeth.

title: MARCUS LIPTON, 77; LABORITE POLITICIAN
description: LONDON, Feb. 22 (AP)Marcus Lipton, one of the bestknown characters in the House of Commons, died in a London hospital today at the age of 77. He was a Labor Party Member of Parliament for 33 years.

title: Opera: Favorita Back at the Met
description: UNTIL TUESDAY NIGHT, it was over 72 years. ago  on Dec. 29; 1905, to be exactthat the Metropolitan Opera last gave Doniietti's La Favorita. Even before the 190506 season, with some of the great singers of the century on hand, La Favorita never had much of a run. Time was beginning to run out on bel canto opera.

title: Byrne Acts to Settle Rate Dispute With Car Insurers
description: TRENTON, Feb. 22The Byrne administration opened a series of private meetings today with insurance company executives at the Governor's home in Island Beach State Park in an attempt to mend fences with the industry.

title: Part of West Side Road To Be Closed Awhile
description: The northbound lanes of the West Side Highway from 46th Street to 72d Street, which were closed on Feb. 13; will remain closed for a matter of months, at least, the New York City Transportation Administration said.

title: Backgammon:
description: Backgammon is considered the world's oldest board game. Early forerunners of the game date back 5,000 years, to the Sumer civilization in southern Mesopotamia, now Iraq. The ancient Egyptians played a version of the game. Indeed, the tomb of Tutankhamen, from the 15th century B.C., contains relics of a game similar to backgammon. Today backgammon is played widely throughout all the Middle Eastern countries bordering the Mediterranean. In other parts of the Middle East, such as Saudi Arabia, the game is just now beginning to take hold. One enthusiastic Middle Eastern player recently demonstrated his strategic sk:Il in the diagrammed position.

title: Sound
description: THE first stereo record came out in 1958. When I recently mentioned this to a frienda working musician much aware of musical trendshe observed that the great upswing in the popularity of Baroque music dates from then. So, on the spur of the moment, we put together a little theory linking theese two events.

title: Cold Weather Heats Up Ski Resorts in Vermont
description: DANBY, Vt., Feb. 22News that some farmers in upstate Vermont would attempt to tap their sugar maples for sap had at least one ski area operator puzzled today. He pointed out that warm afternoons were needed to cause the sap to flow and that it hadn't been above freezing here for 26 days.

title: Apparent Theft of $50,000 at P.B.A. Leaves the Men in Blue RedFaced
description: Somebody has apparently stolen $50,000 from the statewide policemen's union, and officials think was an inside job.

title: Radio
description: 78 A:M., WNCN. Plano Concerto, (K. 107), Mozart; Concerto in D for 3 Horns, Telemann; Love Song, Suk; Symphony in D, Veneziana, Sailed; Flute Fantasia No. 2, Telemann.

title: ExMayor Killed in Philippines
description: ZAMBOANGA, the Philippines, Feb. 22 (AP)An unidentified gunman xilled a former Moslem mayor here today. The police identified the victim as Usman Mundoc, 33 years old, formerly the mayor of Luuk, in the predominantly Moslem province of Sulu. Moslem rebels seeking autonomy for the province have been fighting. Government forces.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Chicago Daily News To Cease March 4
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 22 (AP)The Chicago Daily News, an afternoon paper burdened with declining circulation and losses in the millions of dollars, will cease publication March 4.

title: Canal Pact Foes in Senate Lose Procedural Clash With Backers
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22  Opponents of the Panama Canal treaties mustered 30 votes todayjust four short of the number necessary to defeat the accordsin a losing effort to upset, the leadership schedule for Senate consideration of the treaties.

description: Jeffersonville, Ind., student experiences the effects of cutback in heating

title: Islanders Tie, 33; Bossy: 43d, 44th
description: ATLANTA, Feb.22Guy Chouinard's goal with 6:09 remaining gave the Atlanta Flames their third 33 tie this season with the New York Islanders, but Mike Bossy was the man of the hour. The 21yearold Islander rookie scored his 43d and 44th goals of the season, both while off balance, to tie the National Hockey League record for most goals in one season by a rookie.

title: Critic's Notebook: Sour Note on Security
description: ANY musical performance, whether the artist and the audience realize it or not, is an experiment akin to sawing woman in half. That is, a Rubinstein has more in common with illusionists such as Houdini and Kreskin than with most of his musical colleagues when it comes to building an atmosphere in which an audience can happily suspend disbelief. It is a kind of artistic tableknocking that can put in touch, with a composer, whether dead or alive, and perhaps something beyond music itself.

title: Notes on People
description: IN A DISPUTE WITH certain board members of the Mannes College of Music, Ris Stevens, the former mezzosoprano star of the Metropolitan Opera, has resigned as president of the college effective June 30. In her letter of resignation, Miss Stevens said that in the three years she has been at Mannes, the considerable debt I inherited has been wiped out, the faculty has been strengthened and the orchestra has become a first rate ensemble. But a fourth goal, broadening the scope of the college in vocal music, especially opera, her own first love, has not been achieved, Miss Stevens said. Unfortunately, I have niet only resistance from some members of the board, she said. The school will not have a big creative showcase this year. I do not see any interest in including this art form. I have not been able to convince certain members of the board that this is a direction in which Mannes must expand.

title: William S. Dix, 67
description: Dr. William S. Dix, librarian at Princeton University from 1953 until he retired in 1975, died yesterday in his home, 94 McCosh Circle, Princeton. He was 67 years old.

title: Team Calls for Readmission of 7%
description: ALBANY, Feb. 22A team of specialists sent by the state's Department of Mental Hygiene into Long Beach, has determined that from 7 percent to 10 percent of discharged mental patients there need to be readmitted.

title: Few Sparks Flying in Camp Over Lyle's Absence
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Feb. 22George Steinbrenner and Billy Martin can relax. The other members of their $13 million pitching staff are not sitting around fretting about the absence of gparky Lyle; neither are they resentful that he isn't here nor do they feel he is taking advantage of them.

description: Morning

title: Joan Little Ordered Extradited by Carey
description: ALBANY, Feb. 22Citing his constitutional obligation, Governor Carey ordered today that Joan Little be returned to North Carolina, where she fled last October from a prison that she said had singled her out for abuse.

title: U.S. AND BONN AGREE TO CEASE DISPUTING ECONOMICS IN PUBLIC
description: BONN, Feb. 22The United States and West Germany have privately agreed to end their lingering public argument about whether the Germans are pulling their weight in stimulating the world economy, a source close to Chancellor Helmut Schmidt said today.

title: St. John's in Tourney
description: St. John's and Army were among five teams selected yesterday for the Eastern College Athletic Conference's three divisional basketball tournaments next week. The seven remaining teams will benanied Sunday. The winner of each tournament will receive an automatic berth in the 32team National Collegiate Athletic Association field.

title: Graham Dancers Booked Into Met for Late June
description: The Martha Graham Dance Company will appear at the Metropolitan Opera House from June 26 to July 1.

title: Personal Beauty
description: UNTIL RECENTLY, the fashion designers and the beauty makers had their own turf. Seventh Avenue made clothes, Fifth Avenue created face treatments and fragrances. Then, following the lead or the European couture, designers started stepping over the barrier and produced perfumes signed with their names. Perfumes were profitable and didn't involve producing a new collection each season.

title: Food for Thought About Insectivores
description: CARNIVOROUS plants, like yoyos, gyroscopes and Slinkies, make their inevitable appearance during the childhood years and then again when we become parents. The yoyos and Slinkies don't present much of a recurrence problem; once they're discarded, it's simple enough to make new ones for the next wave of enthusiasts. Not so with carnivorous plants. Their popularity as novelties may well lead them to extinctionif the developers don't eradicate them first.

title: Home Beat
description: SUE GEISMAR was reading a shelter magazine a couple; of years ago, saw an Art Deco chair in Yves Saint Laurent's apartment andit hit her: Wouldn't a chair like that look great with somes wans entwined. around it? As a . Los Angeles decorator, Mrs. Geismar knew how to have a prototype made. And whil she was at it, she designed some other pieces and then, two months ago, opened Vermillion, her own tothetrad furniture showroom in the heart of L.A.'s decorative showroom areanot far from LondonMarquis. That's the showroom owned by the two young women who made a huge success designing and manufacturing treetrunk furniture.

description: Early incomplete and unofficial returns indicated yesterday that the public is against Mayor Koch's use of mothballed city limousine.

description: LONDON, Feb. 22The House of Commons gave final approval tonight to a historic but muchmodified bill granting limited home rule to Scotland.

title: Plants, Fearing Lack of Power, Hasten to Acquire: Generators
description: ST. BERNARD, Ohio, Feb. 22When, the small chemical processing, facility of the Sherwin Williams Company here recently spent $55,000 to purchase a 500kilowattanhour electric power generator unit, the move secured the jobs of some 200 plant workers against layoffs in the event of sharp power cutbacks by its powerstarved utility.

title: People and Business
description: Rodney C. Gott, chairman and chief executive officer of AMF Incorporated, announced yesterday that R. William McNealy Jr. would be elected a vice chairman and director of the leisure and industrial products company, effective March 7.

title: Cleaning The Patchwork Quilt
description: AS the popularity of the patchwork. quilt has increased, so have questions on proper care. Quilts were made by, earlier generations of American women to be used and enjoyed. But how one is used should be decided on its quality, as ah historical textile, and on its value to you. The very old quilts that are found today have survived because they were the best and were brought out only when the parson came to Sunday dinner.

title: Key Rhodesian For Moderates
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Feb. 22When Prime Minister Ian D. Smith reached agreement on constitutional terms for a transfer of power to this country's black majority last week, one. of the three black leaders who, negotiated with his was a tall, somewhat stiff figure in a pinstripe suit best known for the fact that he and an associate were the first black men ever to serve in a Rhodesian Government.

description: SAILING TODAY

description: JERUSALEM, Feb. 22An attempt to oust Foreign Minister Moshe Dayan; for having disclosed that Israel was giving military aid to Ethiopia was blocked in Parliament today.

description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22The House agreed today, to scrap production, of two final B1 strategic bombers.

description: CAIRO, Feb. 22Egypt broke diplomatic relations with the Cyprus Government today after a funeral here for 15 Egyptian commandos killed Sunday at Larnaca airport had turned into a demonstration against Palestinians as well as Cypriots.

title: Syracuse 70, Niagara 69
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N.Y., Feb. 22 (AP) Marty Byrnes hit a turnaround layup with 18 seconds left tonight to give 17thranked Syracuse a 1069 victory over Niagara.

description: SAMUEL HOPPER, once a prominent White Plains grocer, saw a future at the turn of the century for what, was little more than a thriving village. It had a

title: About Real Estate
description: DOBBS FERRY, N.Y.Rugged place, Westchester County. Rocks and boulders fill many of its hilly woods, creating forbidding terrain for construction.

title: Music: Tretyakov Plays Trio
description: IF Viktor Tretyakov's program in Carnegie Hall on Wednesday night was almost numbingly conventional, the playing was not, The Soviet violinist, who is fast becoming a familiar concert artist here, opined with the Brahms Scherzo movement in C minor, continued with Beethoven's Kreutzer Sonata and ended with Prokofiev's First Sonata.

title: Auctions
description: A TORAH in its gemencrusted, parcelgilt ark turned out last week to be far rarer than Sotheby Parke Bernet of London had realized. Followed the sale of the Judaica treasure for the record price of 11,000, or about $21,300, Peter Ehrenthal, its new owner, disclosed that the early 19thcentury Austrian scroll is the smallest Torah known. Each 42line column of text occupies space about the size of a commemorative postage stamp7/8 of an inch wide by 1% inches long. The parchment itself measures 2 1/4 inches from top to bottom.

title: 2 Psychiatrists, in Turnabout, Call Son of Sam Suspect Fit for Trial
description: Two courtappointed psychiatrists who nearly six months ago found David R. Berkowitz mentally unfit to stand trial have now changed their minds and decided that the:suspect in the 44caliber killings is fit to stand trial for murder in Brooklyn.

title: City Opera: Traviata Ofens the New Season
description: IN PROSPECT, the New York City Opera appeared to have the ingredients of a triumphant beginning last night, when the spring portion of its season opened. The production, by no means new, but still one of the company's stronger efforts, was La Traviata, in Frank Corsaro's dramatically crafty staging. And the Violetta was Mariana Niculescu, the Rumanian soprano who made her City Oper debut last fall in this same work to some fairly spectacular notices.

title: Assembly Votes Bill to Strengthen ChildVisitation Rights in Divorce
description: ALBANY, Feb. 23In a move designed to put teeth into courtordered childvisitation agreements, the Assembly passed a bill to give judges the power to withhold alimony from those who refused to allow their former spouses to visit their children.

title: Koch Plans Tougher Zoning LawsTo Bar New Smut Shops Midtown
description: In the city's latest effort to drive the sex industry out of midtown Manhattan, the Koch administration is planning tougher zoning restrictions to discourage new pornography establishments and tax subsidies to encourage other businesses to remain or move into the area.

title: Penn State Takes Steps to Spare Energy in State's Coal Shortage
description: STATE COLLEGE, Pa., Feb. 23Pennsylvania State University today took steps to conserve energy in the state's coal shortage, extending by a week its forthcoming break in classes and sharply reducing the use of electrical power in all university buildings at the campus here.

title: Maple Syrup Tapping At Nature Center
description: Maplesyrup production can be seen firsthand Sunday at 2 P.M. at the Greenburgh Nature Center, Dromore Road in Scarsdale. N.Y.

title: Indecision on Settlement Policy Worrying Israelis in Sinai
description: NUWEIBA, Israelioccupied Sinai While Israeli politicians and foreign diplomats in faraway Tel Aviv and Jerusalem argue over the controversial settlement policy in occupied Arab lands, Ofer Eden and Allon Wolfish are growing watermelons in a patch of irrigated Egyptian desert by the cobaltblue waters of the Gulf of Aqaba.

title: Soviet Issues Pact It Offered Japan
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 23 (Reuters)  The Soviet Union published today the draft of a treaty of goodneighbor relations and cooperation that it offered to Japan last month.

description: NEWARK Feb. 23 (AP)United States Attorney Robert J. Del Tufo charged today that state Senators William J. Musto of Union City and Martin L. Greenberg of East Orange, both Democrats, were improperly using their positions on the Senate Judiciary Committee to further Mr. Musto's defense against gambling conspiracy charges.

title: 5 Years Affer Wounded Knee, Elections Show Tribal Splits
description: PINE RIDGE, S.D., Feb. 23  Tribal elections are being held at the Pine Ridge Reservation with the Oglala Sioux considerably calmer than they were a few years ago, but still deeply divided.

title: Market Place
description: On the face of it, the latest figures from the New York Stock Exchange concerning investor borrowing to finance securities purchases seem positive. The overall level of such debt dropped in January by $150 million to $9.59 billion. But a closer look less encouraging,

title: FilmForum: Radical'Sphinx':Tackling an Enigma
description: In "Riddles of the Sphinx," Laura Mulvey, a feminist and film critic, and Peter Wollen, author of "Signs and Meaning in the Cinema," reduce the story of a housewife's radicalization to a set of 13 360-degree pan shots. (The film plays part of this week and next at the Film Forum.)"The point," write the co-directors in a set of accompanying program notes, "is not so much to distance the spectator from the narrative, but to split his/her interest and tension between the story line and the workings of the camera (and soundtrack)." But with all his/her work done by the film makers, the poor spectator will be hard pressed to function as an interested observer. A technique this ironclad loses its power to provoke.Some of the early 360-degree shotsone around the woman's kitchen, and another that circles the inside of her house as her husband packs and leavesare coolly effective. But the latter part of the film is so hamstrung by this format that it becomes numbing. Aside from the 13 pans, there are shots of Miss Mulvey pondering the story of the Sphinx and Oedipus, extreme close-ups of the Sphinx to establish that film is indeed a grainy medium, and other equally overbearing episodes. None of this is genuinely challenging, and none of it comes alive.
