title: Alexandre Tarsaidze, 77; Czarist Emigre Acquired OwnPublic Relations Firm
description: Alexandre George Tarsaidze, a public relations executive and writer who was prominent among the migr czarist nobility in New York, died Saturday at his home at 520 East 76th Street. He was 77 years old.

title: Senate Mourns Gen. James
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (AP)The Senate today voted approval of a resolution expressing sorrow and regret at the death of Air Force Gen. Daniel James. General James, 58 years old, the first black fourstar general, died Saturday after a heart attack in Colorado Springs.

title: Museum Closing Backed in Nassau
description: ROSLYN HARBOR, L.I., Feb. 27After touring the Nassau County Museum of Fine Arts here today, members of the county's Board of Supervisors said that while rundown conditions warranted the closing of the building to the public, they believed the problems could be corrected And the museum reopened.

title: CONSUMER PRICES UP BY 0.8% FOR JANUARY, DOUBLE AVERAGE RISE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27Led by food, housing and medicalcare costs, consumer prices rose rapidly in January after sever. al months of relatively small increases, the Bureau of Labor Statistics reported today.

title: A GIFT TO NEEDIEST FOLLWAS TRADITION
description: A family tradition that spans more than a half century was recalled by Viola and Dorothea Richtberg of Medford as they sent a check for $10 to the 66th annual appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund. Their letter said:

title: About New York
description: Very soon now, one of the basic chunks of information from New York City's computer watch on its welfare rollthe Social Security numbers of close to one out of five households in the cityWill be summoned up by ex cited technicians and matched agains what they expect will be a rich nelA source for uncovering welfare fraud.

title: 10 Die in Nicaragua As Foes of Somoza Clash With Troops
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, Feb. 27 (AP)Troops clashed with leftist guerrillas and anti-Government protesters today in gun battles and rioting touched off by the announcement of President Anastasio Somoza Debayle that he will continue to rule this turbulent nation until 1981.

title: SWISS CENTRAL BANK ADDS TO CLAIM ON CREDIT SUISSE
description: GENEVA, Feb. 27The Swiss National Bank announced today that it had raised by the equivalent of $10.8 million the amount it had ordered Credit Suisse to pay it because of funds deposited by Italian investors in its branch at Chiasso on the Italian frontier.

title: Egypt Assails Israel on Settlements
description: CAIRO, Feb. 27 (Reuters)  Egypt accused Israel today of obstructing peace efforts through its decision to maintain settlements in the occupied territories.

title: Mrs. Gandhi Wins a Power Base In South India in 2 State Elections
description: NEW DELHI, Tuesday, Feb. 28Eleven months . after being ousted as India's Prime Minister, Indira Gandhi has won a solid power base in the south, apparently insuring her continued presence at the center stage of Indian politics.

title: Issues of Miller's Confirmation AndDollar'sContinuingDecline
description: G, William Miller, President Carter's choice to succeed Arthur F. Burns as chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, is scheduled to go before the Senate Banking Committee today for what is expected to be his final exam- ination before the committee votes on his confirmation, which has been delayed by an investigation of allegedly improper payments made by Tex- tron Inc. In connection with obtaing foreign contracts while Mr. Miller was its chairman.

title: Randle of Mets Threatens to Quit
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb. 27 Lenny Randle, who led the New York Mets in hitting last season, said tonight that he was considering retirement because the team would not extend his fiveyear contract.

title: N.A.A.C.P. to Appeal To Davis Cup Players
description: BILOXI, Miss., Feb. 27A spokesman for the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People isaid today that the group would ask inidividual members of the United States and South African Davis Cup teams to oboycott the series scheduled March 17 through 19 at Vanderbilt University in Nashville.

title: F.D.A. Reports Smugglin o f Laetrile Into Jersey
description: The regional director of the Food and Drug Administration said yesterday that signiifcant quantities of laetrile, the controversial purported cancer cure, are being smuggled illegally into New Jersey and sold on the black market.

title: COLUMBIA RESUMES TRADE, MOVING LOWER ON THE DAY
description: Shares in Columbia Pictures Industries, which did not trade on Friday on the New York Stock Exchange, opened yesterday at 14, down  from Thursday's last New York trade, and closed at 14, down . In nationwide consolidated trading, the stock closed at 14, down  on the day,

title: City College Tops Brooklyn in Final 6458
description: With a strong secondhalf rally, City College pulled out a 6458 victory ever Brooklyn College last night for the Beavers third consecutive City University of New York championship.

title: Bucknell 88, 1K.,Chester St. 73
description: LEWISBURG, Pa. (AP)Reggie Baker starred tonight as Bucknell defeated West Chester State, 8873, in an B.C.C. playoff opener.

title: Britons Dwindle to Minority in London Theater Audiences
description: LONDONForeign visitors are occupying an increasing percentage of seats in London's theaters, while British theatergoers are doing something of a disappearing act.

title: ExPenney Auditors Sue Officers for Harassment In Investigation of Fraud
description: Two former auditors of the J. C. Penney Company have filed suit in Federal District Court in Manhattan alleging that several of the company's top officials obtained improper payments and then participated in a plan to conceal their wrongdoing.

title: N.C.A.A. Accused of Bribery To Uncover Rule Violations
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27National Collegiate Athletic Association investigators were charged today with using bribery as a means of obtaining information against N.C.A.A. member colleges, and one N.C.A.A. investigator was accuses of calling ott nis inquiry of the University of Mississippi after an Ole Miss athlete procured a woman for the investigator.

title: Dissident Unionists In Moscow Pledge Continuing Struggle
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 27Supporters of an unofficial labor union that was organized here last month said today that five members, including its leader, had disap- peared after being arrested and that the authorities had committed two others to psychiatric hospitals.

title: World News Briefs
description: ROME, Feb. 27 (AP)Cuban soldiers have entered combat for the first time against rebels in Ethiopia's northern province, Eritrea, a representative of the insurgents said today. Cubans already had been reported fighting alongside Ethiopian troops in their Ogaden war against Somali secessionists at the other end of the country,

title: Colombia's Governing Party Gains In an Election Marked by Apathy
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Feb. 27Colombia's governing Liberal Party has apparently consolidated its majority in Parliament in elections held yesterday and, in a related primary, selected former For- eign Minister Julio Csar Turbay Ayala as its presidential candidate.

title: Taxes &
description: Taxpayers may not be settling up their bills with more graciousness, but they certainly are doing it with far fewer mistakes than last year, according to the Internal Revenue Service.

title: Brooklyn Views Molnar And Play's the Thing
description: Either one is a playwrightor one isn't, says Sandor Turai (Rene Auherjonois), the gracefully manipulative principal character in Ferenc Molnar's The Play's the

title: TV: Jerusalem Peace Tonight
description: Making a film about Jerusalem that might fairly depict Israelis and Arabs without one side or the other contending there was distortion is probably impossible. The divisive issues are too emotional, too entrenched, too steeped in propaganda. But Jerusalem Peace,, which can be seen on Channel 13 tonight at 8, makes a laudable, and, for the outsider, a valuable effort to bring an element of objectivity to a troubled scene.

title: A Coal Miner With a Pretty Good Life
description: CEDAR GROVE, W.Va., Feb. 27The mines have left their mark on Homer Otto Buckner and his family. Like his father before him, he has blacklung disease, though his case is not serious enough to keep him out of the tunnels. And he has a borther who is paralyzed because of back fracture suffered in a rock fall in a mine.

title: People and Business
description: The election of John P. Sachs as president and chief executive officer of the Great Lakes Carbon Corporation was announced yesterday by Rushton W. Skakel, chairman. Dr. Sachs, who is 51 years old, has been with the company since 1966, serving as vice presidentoperations and group vice president. He succeeds Joseph G. Solari, 60, who has retired.

title: Jascalevich Jury Selection Starts
description: HACKENSACK, N.J., Feb. 27Jury selectionb egan here today in the murder trial of Dr. Mario E. Jascalevich, the 50-year-old surgeon charged with killing five patients at Riverdell Hospital in Oradell in the 196567 period.

title: Hazardous Chemicals Are Vital to Nation's Industiy
description: The nation runs on chemicals that can burn, explode, asphyxiate or poison. Three separate rail accidents over the weekend were reminders that sometimes such chemicals can get loose, with fatal results.

title: Providence 85, L.I.U. 62
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., Feb. 27 (UPI)Bruce Campbell and Bill Eason scored 15 points apiece and led Providence College to an 8562 victory over Long Island University tonight.

title: She Studies Societies That Brutalize Women
description: LEXINGTON, Mass.After decades of travel, study and observation, Fran Hosken, an architect and feminist, is appalled by what she feels is the lack of information among women of different countries about their common, and not-so-common, problems.

title: Hospital Says FundRaising Lags Because of EilbergFlood Matter
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 27Controversy surrounding Hahnemann Hospital's receipt of $14.5 million in Federal funds as a result of Congressional influence has caused difficulty in raising additional funds and embarrassment in asking for any, officials at the hospital said today.

title: New World Consort Sings of Old
description: Criticism is always subjective, but every once in awhile its subjectiv: nature becomes especially apparent. Sunday night at Christ and St. Stephen's Church, 120 West 69th Street, an oldmusic grcup called the New World Consort presented a program entitled The Troubadours of 12th Century Provence. The place was packed, and most people seemed delighted by what they had seen and heard. This churl was less entranced.

title: A Policy Dispute Blocks Braniff Flights to London
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27The start of direct airline service between Dallas and London'was put in jeopardy today by dispute between the British and American Governments.

title: Syria Seeking Soviet Aid
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Feb. 27 (UPI)The chief of staff of Syria's armed forces, Gen. Hikmat Shehabi, left for Moscow this afternoon on what officials described as a mission to complete arrangements for bolstering Syria's defense potential.

title: Amnesty International Expresses Concern at Bangladesh Executions
description: LONDON, Feb. 27 (Reuters)Amnesty International today expressed concern over what it described as summary executions of military personnel in Bangladesh and the large number of political prisoners in the country.

title: State Senate Backs Guarantees For Business Operating Loans
description: TRENTON, Feb. 27The Senate approved a plan today that would al:ow the state government 'o guarantee business operating loans. Designed to help revive industry. in New Jerse''s cities, W.is a cornerstone in Goveknor Byrne's economic recovery plan.

title: The Mideast Plane Sales Package: How U.S. Decision Was Reached
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27As he sped away from the snowcovered Presidential retreat of Camp David two weeks ago, Secretary of Defense Harold Brown took with him the most sensitive foreign policy decision the Carter Administration has made to date.

title: City Legal Staff Indicts Working Conditions
description: In a room on the 17th floor of the Municipal Building, six lawyers of the general litigation division of the city's Department of Law toil away with the benefit of only three telephones.

title: Recital: Sonata Evening by Ponti
description: MICHAEL PONT!, planist. Alice Tully Hail. Sonatas in t B minor (L. 449), 8 (L. 450), A (L. 494), A minor (L. 429), D minor (L. 423), D (L. 415) Scarlattl Sonata No. 3 In B minor (Oa. 50) ...Chopin Sonata No. 4 In F sharp (OP. 30) ..Scriabin Sonata In B flat minor (OP. 36, original 1913 version)............................... title: J.S. Said to Defer Plan for Plane Sales to Morocco
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27The Carter Administration has bowed to some strong Congressionl  opposition and deferred ;indefinitely a plan to sell aircraft to Morocco for use in the Western Sahara against* Algerianbacked guerrillas, State Department officials said today.

title: Israel and Egypt Still Far Apart On Drafting a Peace Declaration
description: JERUSALEM, Feb. 27Egypt and Israel still appeared far apart today on a mutual declaration of peace principles.

title: Hrs. Gandhi Wins a Power Base In South India in 2 State. Elections
description: NEW DELHI, Tuesday, Feb. 28Eleven months after being ousted as India's Prime Minister, Indira Gandhi has won a solid power base in the south, apparently insuring her continued presence at the center stage of Indian politics.

title: The Capital's Bars: White House Staff Has Its Favorites
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27  Hamilton Jordan may have a penchant for the Georgetown bar called Sarsfield's, with Its town house atmosphere and collegetype revels, but White House. aides don't all frequent the same place after work.

title: Market Place
description: Some investors who have lost money in stock options have discovered that without risking a great deal more they can try for bigger profits in an unexpected area: bankrupt, corporations.

title: Britons Dwindle to Minority in London Theater Audiences
description: LONDONForeign visitors are occupying an increasing percentage of seats in London's theaters, while British theatergoers are doing something of a disappearing act.

title: Article 2 -- No Title
description: Article 2 -- No Title

title: HENRY SELDIS, CRITIC AND LECTURER ON ART
description: A memorial service for Henry Seldis, art critic for The Los Angeles Times, who was found dead in his apartment in Los Angeles last Wednesday, will be held at 6:30 P.M. Thursday in, the Leo F. Bing Theater of the Los Angeles County Museum of Art.

title: ACCORD IS REACHED AT CURTISSWRIGHT
description: WOODRIDGE, Feb. 27Two unions representing 1,200 workers locked out.of their jobs at the CurtissWright aerospace plant here for the last 11 weeks have reached agreement on a tentative 39month contract that union negotiators acknowledge falls considerably short of their demands.

title: St. Joseph's 90, Drexel 80
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 27 (AP)Jeffrey Clark, a freshman, scored 20 points, including six straight free throws in overtime, and led St. Joseph's to a 9080 victory over Drexel tonight in the opening round of the E.C.C. playoffs.

title: Adams Says Neglected Roadbeds Are Key Factor in Rail Accidents
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27Brock Adams, the Secretary of Transportation, said today that dangerously neglected roadbeds and equipment have been a primary contributor to train accidents, such as the derailments that led to the deaths Of 20 persons in Tennessee and Florida over the weekend.

title: Judge Wright, Focus of Dispute, Is Reassigned to Criminal Court
description: Just before 9:30 yesterday morning, Bruce McM. Wright stuffed his radio and some lawbooks into a paper bag, ran for an elevatorwhere he accepted congratulations on his new assignment dashed across the street to iuu uentre Street, asked to be pointed to the courtroom where he was expected, and got to work.

title: Robert Sobukwe, a Black Leader In South Africa, Dies of Cancer
description: Robert Mangalisco Sobukwe, the black South African nationalist leader who founded the PanAfrican Congress and envisioned a democratic Africa based on the American model, died yesterday of lung cancer in Kimberley, South Africa.

title: The Economic Scene
description: Leonard Silk reports that the continuing decline of the dollar on international currency markets is building pressure on the Senate to act quickly on the nomination of G. William Miller as chairman of the Federal Reserve Board. Page 49.

title: South Bronx Leaders Complain They're Ignored on Revival Plans
description: South Bronx political leaders complained bitterly yesterday that they and their constituents were being shut out of planning for the cityFederal effort to rebuild their devastated neighborhoods.

title: Terms of Proposed Mine Contract
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (UPI)Following is a summary of the proposed coal miners contract as released by the United Mine Workers:

title: U .S . Court Upholds A ddonizio Release, Citing Rules Change
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 27 (AP)  A Federal appeals court today upheld the release from prison of former Newark Mayor Hugh .1. Addonizio after he had served five years and two months of a 10year sentence for extortion and conspiracy.

title: Begin to Arrive in U.S. March 13
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (AP)  The White House formally announced today that Prime Minister Menachem Begin of Israel would arrive here March 13 for discussions with President Carter about ArabIsraeli negotiations.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Jack Teich, a 38-year-old Kings point L.I., businessman who was kidnapped in 1974 and released after his family paid a $750,000 ransom, described his weeklong ordeal to a Jury in Nassau County Court in Mineola yesterday as the prosecution opened its case against Richard Warren Williams, one of eight men accused of carrying out the abduction. Mr. Williams seized in California in 1976, is the only suspect arrested. Mr. Teich described how he had been abducted from in front of, his home and held chained and blindfolded in closet during a week of rpeated threats.

title: Koch Decides Cadillac Has Got to Wait
description: Mayor Koch said yesterday he would settle for the deathmobile as his official car, with a station wagon for a backup. And the Chrysler Corporation will fix them bothfree.

title: Dr. Margarete Bieber, Historian, Authority on Greek and Roman Art
description: Dr. Margarete Bieber, a leading authority on Greek and Roman art, an author, historian and archeologist at Columbia University for many years, died Saturday in her home at 87 Gerdes Road in New Canaan, Conn. She was 98 years old.

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, FEBRUARY 28, 1978 Egypt has restricted Palestinian privileges granted for more than 20 years to those living in Egypt. An announcement said the Palestinians would be treated the same as other Arab aliens. This reprisal for the murder of a prominent Cairo editor by Palestinian terrorists and Palestinian criticism of President Anwar elSadat was announced in Parliament by Prime Minister Mamdouh Salem. Since 1956, the 30,000 Palestinians in Egypt have had virtually the same status as Egyptians except for the rights to vote and hold office. They have had the same legal rights and employment and business opportunities and had been given preferentialadmission to universities. LPage 1, Column 1.1

title: Our Vietnam Duty Is Not Over
description: The horror that was Indochina seems never to stop. Thailand, it is now Confirmed, has been returning hundreds of Laotian refugees to Communist Laos. The shooting to death of a Laotian woman and her two children was observed last week by the Thai officials who forced them back across the border. Other returnees have been taken away at gunpoint to imprisonment at the least.

title: Radio
description: 710, WKCR. Das Marienleben, Hindemith.

title: Business Lifts Outlay Estimate 3%
description: Despite numerous negative factors, American business now plans to spend 14 percent more in 1978 than it did in 1977 and 3 percent more than business was expected to spend when surveyed last year, the McGrawHill Publications Company reported yesterday.

title: MCA's Earnings Increased by 53% In Fourth Quarter and 5% in Year
description: MCA Inc., the leader in television film production and one of the more profitable motionpicture producers, reported a 53 percent profit increase in the fourth quarter and a 5 percent gain for all of last year, the company's report disclosed yesterday.

title: Laetrile Smuggling Is Reported
description: The regional director of the Food and Drug Administration said yesterday that significant quantities of laetrile, the controversial purported cancer cure, were being smuggled illegally into New Jersey and sold on the black market.

title: BRONX SCHOOL GRANT OF $44,00015 SAVED
description: The Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare yesterday approved a $44,000 grant for a program that his department had . earlier retjected as ethnically unbalanced.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Paintings Are Museum Characters
description: Museum, a new play by. Tina Howe at the Public Theater, gives us the pictures point of view. That is, the three exhibits in the unchanging white gallery remain fixed for the whole time, except for one which may or may not he having a mystical experience. It is the people who flash by and blur.

title: School Pancake Supper Devotes Profits to Neediest Cases Fund
description: A pancake supper held recently by the Chapel Vestry of TrinityPawling School in Pawling, N. Y., resulted in a contribution of $50 to the 66th annual appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: NUCLEAR FUEL PLAN THWARTS DIVERSION
description: The development of a nuclearfuel recycling system that would prevent the diversion of plutonium from future breed er power plants into weaponry was disclosed yesterday by research officials from the United States and Britain.

title: New Calliope Singers, a Chorus Of 20 Mixed Voices, in Concert
description: A chorus with a conductor named Schubert had better be good, and the young group named the New Calliope Singers.maintained a respectable standard in its concert at Carnegie Recital Hall on Sunday night. Peter Schubert, who is on the staff of Barnard College, led his chamber chorus of 20 mixed voices in a program that not only dared an a cappella version of Bach's motet Jesu, meine Freude but also half a dozen modern works, including two first performances.

title: Joan Mondale Named to Head Council of Arts
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27Joan Mondale was appointed today by President Carter as honorary head of the Federal Council of the Arts and the Humanities. The council will undertake a major review of the arts and cultural policy of the United Slates.

title: St John's Defeats Niagara As Johnson Stars by 6960
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N.Y., Feb. 27 (AP) --George Johnson led a 100 scoring surge for St. John's early in the second half and the Redmen went on to post a 69.60 basketball victory over Niagara tonight.

title: Short Hair Again or a Carefree Spring and Summer
description: If hairdressers have their way, a lot of hair is going to land on beauty salon floors this spring, Women are beginning to tire of yards of frizz that take forever to dry and need a lot of fussing.

title: ELIZABETH C. RAPPLEYE
description: Elizabeth Cunningham Rappleye, the widow of Dr. Willard Cele Rappleye, for-

title: Supreme Court Roundup Exclusion of Puerto Rico in Welfare Rise Backed
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27The Supreme Court ruled today that reducing the benefits of welfare recipients who move from the United States to Puerto Rico is not violation of their constitutional right travel.

title: Deaths
description: ABUZAMoses C. Devoted father of Charles. Loving grandfather of Zachary M. and Alexandra C. Dear father-in-law of Suzy. Services Thursday 10AM Riverside Chapel, 76 St & Amsterdam Ave, NYC.

title: Music: 3 New York Premieres
description: On the eve of its departure for a fiveweek tour of the Soviet Union, the New York Pro Arte Chamber Orchestra, under the leadership of its founderconductor Raffael Adler, assembled in Alice Tully Hall Sunday night for an au revoir concert. me program by the 12piece string orchestra featured, as is customary with this group, a generous amount of unusual fare including three New Yon:. premieres.

title: Poor Blacks Future
description: CHICAGOOne of the hidden consequences of basic economic changes in the United States has been the decreasing significance of race, and, therefore, the growing importance of class in determining blacks chances in life.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: CARSON, Calif.,Feb. 27 (UPI)Nls. san  U.S.A. announced today that would raise suggested retail prices on Datsun cars and pickup trucks by an average of $82, or 1.6 percent, effective Wednesday. Vehicles already in dealer stocks at that time, will not be affected, the company said.

title: Business Records
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT Monday, Feb. 27, 1978 Petition filed by;

title: A Novelist's Parole Is Just a Short Story
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Feb. 27 (UPI)When he was 27 yearsold, Emil R. Johnson sentenced to 40 years In state prison for killing a filling station operator who was kneeling with his hands tied behind him.

title: Wall St. Notes Drop InOppositiontoRise In BigClient Rates
description: Despite, some strong pockets of resistance, leading Wall Street brokers seem to be encountering far less opposition than originally perceived in their efforts to increase the commission rates they charge big clients.

title: Orders for Machine Tools Remained High During January
description: Orders for machine tools, one of the barometers of capital spending by American businesses, remained at high levels in January, totaling $315,9 million, down 1 percent from the $318.7 million last December.

title: Hall of Fame Plans Dropped
description: JERSEY CITY, Feb. 27 (AP)Plans to put a hall of fame for great Americans in Liberty Park here have been rejected by the New Jersey Department of Envi-

title: 13 POLICE, 54 AIDES ARRESTED IN 2 YEARS IN NEW YORK INQUIRY
description: Thirteen police officers and 54 civilian employees of the Police Department have been arrested in a twoyear undercover investigation of gambling and narcotics activities in Brooklyn and other parts of the city, authorities said yesterday.

title: Syracuse 100, Canisius 59
description: SYRACUSE, Feb. 27 (AP)Marty Byrnes scored 17 points and grabbed 15 rebounds as Syracuse overpowered Canisius, 10059, tonight and ended its regular season with a 22.4 record.

title: Manhattan 95, Seton Hall 86
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N.J., Feb. 27Manhattan College upset tourneybound Seton Hall, 95.86, and spoiled Glenn Mosley Night for a partisan crowd of 3,000.

title: New York City Asks a Rollback in Employee Benefits
description: The Koch administration, opening contract negotiations with a coalition of municipal unions yesterday, proposed that a wide array of benefits and practices be eliminated, and insisted that there could be no general wage increase.

title: Flames Three Late Goals Overcome Rangers by 53
description: Having beaten Chicago and upset Montreal in their previous two games, the New ork Rangers appeared to find the prospect of a third straight victory too dizzying to contemplate last night as they lost to the Atlanta Flames, 53, last night at Madison Square Garden.

title: Stocks Tumble After Getting News Of Spurt in Consumer Price Index
description: Bad news on the inflation front weakened the stock market yesterday in slower trading.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: An. article in The Times yesterday, inadvertently stated that J. Ray McDermott & Company had admitted making illegal kickbacks and political contributions between 1965 and 1976 totaling $1.1 billion. The questionable payments and contributions cited actually totaled $1.1 million.

title: Pop: In SauterFinegan Band Mold
description: The complex arrangements that Eddie Sauter and Bill Finegan wrote for their .SauterFinegan Orchestra 25 years ago 7- arrangements built on shards, slivers and layers of sound that mixed peeps, rumbles, airy piccolos, pastoral English horn passages, blustering trombones, tightly muted trumpets and the percussion section bristling with mallet instrumentscame to life Sunday night at the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A. in the third annual concert by the Studio Orchestra, conducted by Harvey Estrin.

title: Rate Lifted to 8 3/4% On Home Mortgages
description: The maximum interest rate, on Governmentbacked singlefamily home mortgages was raised yesterday to 8 3/4 percent from 8 1/2 percent in an effort to increase the volume of financing available to moderateincome home buyers.

title: Medal of Honor Awarded
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (UPI)The Navy today posthumously awarded the Medal of Honor to Capt. Michael J. Estocin, a pilot who was listed as missing in action for more than 10 years in North Vietnam but was declared dead only three months ago. Captain Estocin, of Turtle Creek, Pa. received the medal for his heroism on Pa., 20 and 26, 1967, as leader of a threeplane group.

title: Recovery, Falters in Credit Markets as Federal Funds Rate Increases
description: The credit markets attempted yesterday to keep alive the recovery that got start ed late last week but they were unsuccessful, Bond prices rose in the morning and early afternoon and then drifted back downward to close with small declines.

title: Governors Urge Carter to Facilitate Nuclear Power
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27  President Carter reportedly told the nation's goveronors today that his comprehensive new plan for disposing of radioactive waste from nuclear power plants would be ready by the end of the year, an action that would speed development of nuclear power.

title: Advice and Consent
description: The Senate may ultimately approve the Panama Canal treaties, but who can now approve the state of the United States treatymaking process?

title: Senator Asks Data On Marston Case In Civiletti Hearing
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27Senator Malcolm Wallop said today that the Senate Judiciary Committee could not conduct a thorough inquiry into Benjamin R. Civiletti's fitness to be Deputy Attorney General without a full range of documents and records on the removal of David W. Marston as the United States Attorney in Philadelphia.

title: Black Progress and Poverty AreUnderlinedby Statistics
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27In 1976, black families had a median Income of $9,252, an increase of 105 percent over 10 years. In that same year, 30 percent of all black families earned $15,000 or more. A decade ago, only 2 percent were at that level.

title: Snowmobile Crash Fatal To Minnesota Racer
description: BEAUSEJOUR, Manitoba, Feb. 27 (AP)Jerry Bunke, a professional snowmobile racer from Roseau, was killed yesterday when he was thrown from his machine during a Canadian powertoboggan championship race. Bunke, 26 years old, was hit by a snowmobile after his machine collided with another.

title: More ExOfficials, Purged in the 60's, Reappear in Peking
description: PEKING,Feb. 27 (Reuters)Several more longtime Communists purged during and after the Cultural Revolution have reappeared with the convening of China's Parliament and the unitedfront Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference.

title: `They're Trying to Steal Leon
description: As a Teamsters official in the St. Louis area, Millard (Mitt) Barnes specializes in grievance cases. And now he has a grievance of his own. Mitt Barnes is the boxing manager Leon Spinks, the new world heavyweight champion. But, he said, I get the feeling everybody is the manager but me. They won't let Leon talk to me. They're trying to steal him from me. Mitt Barnes's grievance is not with Leon Spinks; it;is with Bob Arum and Vernon (Butch) Lewis of Top Rank Inc., which has the promotional rights for the new cham- pion's rust tnree title aetenses, plus an option for his next three. Butch Lewis has been heard to describe Leon Spinks as my boy and Bob Arum has identified Milton Chawsky, now the new champion's attorney, as the lawyer we got for him. In order for Leon Spinks to ctetend tne title, Mitt Barnes must approve the opponent and sign the contract. But he's not inclined now to agree to anything in which Top Rank is involved. He is considering litigation against both Bob Arum and Leon Spinksanother example of how in boxing the infighting outside the ring can be more vicious than inside the ring, especially when control of the world heavyweight champion is at stake.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Syria Rejects Visit By U.S. Mediator In Mideast Effort
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 27Syria said today that it had rejected a proposed visit to Damascus this week by Alfred L. Atherton Jr., the special United States representative in the Middle East, be- cause it would not serve a just and lasting peace in the area.

title: Around the Nation
description: DETROIT, Feb. 27Federal District Judge Fred W. Kaess issued an order today to stop an affirmative action program designed to promote more blacks in the Detroit Police Department.

title: New York Countdown Signs of Spring
description: We perceive a thaw in Washington around the roots of the New York City problem. The Carter Administration is prepared to steer an additional $83 million to the city next year provided New York State delivers on its pledge of $200 million more and Mayor Koch finds the $174 million in savings that would close the pending budget gap. More important, a few early birds in the Treasury and Congress now sing of a longerterm Federal role in assuring New York's solvency, and the Administration is digging deeply into state and city affairs, behaving like the national control board that so obviously needed.

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, FEBRUARY 28, 1978

title: New York City Asks a Rollback in Employee Benefits
description: The Koch administration, opening contract negotiations with a coalition of municipal unions yesterday, proposed that a wide array of benefits and practices be eliminated, and insisted that there could be no general wage increase.

title: Hofstra Ousted In Playoff, 9777
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27  Hofstra was eliminated tonight by American Urtiversity, 9777, in the first round ofthe East Coast Conference playoffs.

title: HOW TO AID THE FUND
description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and sent to P.O. Box 5193, Church Street Sta. tion, New York, N.Y. 10249 or to these agencies:

title: Koch Sends Apology To Maligned Bank
description: Mayor Koch has apologized to the Bankers Trust Company for having blamed you for a suggestion that city funds be deposited in interestfree accounts to prevent the closing of bank branches in poor neighborhoods.

title: 2 Nuclear Officials Criticize Aide Over Testimony on Lost Uranium
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27Two members of the Nuclear Regulatory Commission criticized the commission's top staff officull today because he told Congress last summer that there was no evidence that sir nificant amounts of nuclear material had ever been stolen.

title: Jury Selection Starts in Dr. Jascalevich Trial
description: HACKENSACK, Feb. 27Jury selection began here today in the murder trial of Dr. Mario E. Jascalevich, the 50-year-old surgeon charged with killing five patients at Riverdell Hospital in Oradell in the 196567 period.

title: Nets Ask Time To Pay Debt Owed Knicks
description: The New Jersey Nets have requested a moratorium on the $7.2 million in indemnification owed the Knicks until they move into the new arena scheduled for construction in the New Jersey Meadowlands. The scheduled date for the opening of the 20,000seat arena is

title: NKOMO ASSAILS U. S. ON SALISBURY TALKS
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Feb. 27Joshua Nkomo, a black Rhodesian leader in exile, was critical today of Washington's reaction to the accord reached between Prime Minister Ian D. Smith and rival black leaders, and questioned the right of the United States to  participate further in the quest for a broader agreement that would end the guerrilla war.
